loans.name: Pedro Walter

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Mano de León, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, este distrito es netamente agrícola y se encuentra situado a mas de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. Actualmente cuenta con terreno de cultivo de 1.5 hectáreas en el cual siembra maíz, en esta ocasión el cultivo ya ha sido instalado y el se encuentra cuidándolo para garantizarse una buena cosecha.

Pedro desea adquirir fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo.

Pedro es una persona entregada a su familia y que se vale de sus conocimientos en agricultura, fruto de todos los años que lleva trabajando,  para garantizarles el sustento que necesitan.
texts.en:
Pedro is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the village of  Mano de León, a rural area in the Olmos district, located in the province of Lambayeque.  This district is agricultural and is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Pedro has worked in agriculture since he was young.  He now has 1.5 hectares of arable land where he grows corn.  The crop has been planted and he is caring for it to guarantee a good harvest.

Pedro would like to buy fertilizer to maintain his crop, so he has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.  

Pedro is devoted to his family, and he uses his agricultural knowledge gained from all of the years he worked to guarantee them the support they need.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for a corn crop

loans.name: Haydee Paquita

texts.es:
Haydee es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Caminos del Inca, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Cayaltí,  un distrito agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de leche de vaca desde hace más de siete años. Ella cuenta con ganado vacuno y diariamente extrae la leche que producen con sus vecinos y pobladores de la zona. El negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda para su familia.

Ella desea adquirir alimento para su ganado de modo que pueda mantener su producción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Haydee es una mujer responsable y muy entregada a su familia, las personas de la zona que le conocen le consideran una vecina trabajadora y de confianza.
texts.en:
Haydee is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Caminos del Inca, a rural area in the Cayaltí district.  This is a rural area with regular commercial activity that is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has sold cow's milk for more than seven years.  She has a dairy cow and milks it every day so she can sell milk to her neighbors and other residents in her area.  This business is an important source of income for her family.

She would like to buy feed for her cow so that she can maintain its production, so she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve her goal.  

Haydee is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family.  The people in her area who know her consider her a hard-working and trustworthy neighbor.

loans.use: Purchase balanced feed for a dairy cow

loans.name: Carmen María

texts.es:
Carmen María es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad, tiene un hijo y reside junto a su familia en el sector Túpac Amaru del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona ubicada en la región Piura que se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos, ella prepara diversos platos de comida y chicha (bebida típica de la zona que se prepara a base de un tipo especial de harina de maíz), y los vende todos los fines de semana en un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio, adicionalmente vende cerveza. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria de su familia.

El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por ello ha decidido ampliarlo con la preparación de más platos, para lograrlo ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes.

Carmen es una mujer responsable y hogareña, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen María is a mother who is 24 years old, she has one child and resides with her family in the Túpac Amaru sector of the agricultural district called Tambogrande. This area is located in the Piura region, situated more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capitol of the Lambayeque region.

She prepares and sells diverse dishes of food and chicha (a typical drink of this area, which is prepared from a base of a special type of corn flour). She sells these things from a small room in her home every weekend. Additionally, she sells beer. With the income she earns from this activity, she helps her husband to sustain the daily economic well-being of their family. 

The business has had a very good reception by their customers and thus Carmen has decided to expand with the preparation of more dishes. To do this, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in the purchase of consumables and ingredients.

Carmen is a responsible woman and home-loving person. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of consumables and ingredients to expand her business of production and sale of food.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Charán Coposo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona ubicada en la región Piura que se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella realiza los pedidos de sus clientes a una empresa distribuidora, a más pedidos sus ganancias aumentan, por ello siempre se encuentra en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Adicionalmente cría ganado ovino para comercializarlo. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio de venta de cosméticos instalando un pequeño establecimiento que cuente con un inventario fijo de productos, así sus vecinos no tendrán que esperar a que llegue el pedido sino que contarán con los productos que necesitan al alcance de la mano, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles..

María es una mujer responsable y hogareña, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old, has three children, and lives with her family in the village of Charán Coposo in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region about four hours from the city of Chiclayo (capital of the Lambayeque region).

She sells beauty products from catalogs.  She places orders for her customers with a distribution business.  The more orders she places, the more income she earns, so she is always in search of new clients.  She also raises sheep to sell.  With the income she earns from these activities, she helps her husband with their family expenses.

She would like to expand her cosmetics sales business by opening a small establishment where she can have a set inventory of products.  This way, her neighbors won't have to wait for their orders to arrive, and they can count on having the products they need on hand.  In order to achieve this goal, she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a responsible woman.  Her dream is to continue growing her business to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to start a home business

loans.name: Cumbe Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro está formado por 8 personas quienes se dedican  a sus trabajos, trabajos que les han permitido surgir poco a poco e ir mejorando la situación económica de cada uno de ellos. Viven en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frio y en donde la mayor parte de su gente se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también mucha de su gente sale a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes áreas.  

La Señora Nataly M. vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 22 años, es casada y tiene un hijo.  Su esposo trabaja en un almacén de venta de accesorios de celulares el mismo que es de su propiedad. Tienen casa propia la misma que fue construida con el esfuerzo de los dos. 
Doña Nataly tiene un local en donde vende celulares y también los repara, trabaja en esta actividad hace 3 años, labora todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. También entregan a tiendas y locales comerciales maquinas chicleras, esta actividad  la realiza hace un año. 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su esposo,  el dinero de su préstamo lo va a invertir a la compra de mas maquinas chicleras. Su sueño es estudiar alguna carrera universitaria.

La Señorita Andrea M. vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue invitada por su cuñado. Tiene 25 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres la misma que es propia, su padre es chofer y realiza fletes y su madre ya es fallecida hace doce años lo que le causa mucha tristeza.   
Estudia en una academia de corte y confección y está en el último año. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, actividad que la realiza hace un año y medio, sus productos  los vende puerta a puerta a sus amigas y conocidas.
El  dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra  de más cosméticos.  su meta es tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
The 'Cumbe Centro' community bank has 8 members whose work has enabled each one of them to get ahead little by little and improve their economic situation.  They live in Cumbe parish.  This parish has a cold climate and most of its residents raise animals and farm.  A lot of people also go to the city to work in other areas.

Nataly M. lives in Cumbe parish.  She is 22 years old,  married, and has one child.  Her husband has a store which sells cell phone accessories.  They have their own home which was built through their joint effort.

Nataly has a premises where she sells and repairs cell phones.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She works every day from 7 in the morning until 9 in the evening.  She also delivers gumball machines to stores and commercial premises.  She has been doing this for one year.

This is Nataly's first loan with her community bank and she was invited by her husband.  Her loan will be used to buy more gumball machines.  Her dream is to study at university.

Miss Andrea M. lives in Cumbe parish.  This is the first loan which she has had as a member of her community bank.  She was invited to join by her brother-in-law.  She is 25 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home which they own.  Her father is a driver and carries cargo.  Her mother died twelve years ago which caused her a lot of sadness.

Andrea studies dressmaking and she is in is her last year of her course.  She has also been selling cosmetics for a year and a half.  She sells her products door to door to her friends and acquaintances.

Her loan will be invested in buying more cosmetics.  Her goal is to have a dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: To buy gumball machines and cosmetics

loans.name: Mykailo

texts.en:
Mykailo is married with two children. He owns a retail business selling construction supplies.  Mykailo has been in this business for 8 years.  His honesty and friendly attitude attracts many customers.  

A large assortment allows his customers to make good choices and purchase what they need at his store.  Since this business is the only source of income for his family Mykailo would like to develop it further.  He is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of his inventories. Mykailo hopes to make additional income and improve his family living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of his inventories.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta C. is a 55-year old widow who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: general store, buying and selling of fermented shrimps and a pig fattening business.  She lives in Kumon, Brgy. Daan Banwa, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her general store, buying and selling of fermented shrimps and pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. 

Violeta is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Violeta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Pasayan, Brgy. Tomongtong, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a tricycle, ready to wear clothes sales and avon dealer businesses.  Her husband Ramil, who is 36 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 12 years old. 

Belly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use for the maintenance of the motorcycle and to buy stocks of clothing so that she could continue to save up for future education of her child and home repairs. 

Belly S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Her husband Rey D., who is 47 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between the ages of 9 to 20 years old. 

Leonena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leonena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children.

Leonena D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba A. is 34-years old, married and supports her family by operating a business buying and selling livestock.  She lives in Purok Lawis 2, Brgy. Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her buying and selling livestock business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP 8,000.  Melba is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she could continue to fund the operations of her livestock business.   This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melba aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila R. is forty years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Purok 4 within Mansabay Bajo barangay, a part of the municipality of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Mila sells fish. She has been in business for ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Mila is requesting a new loan, her tenth from PMPC, of 20,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more fish and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and for working capital

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rengie

texts.en:
Rengie T. is a married woman who lives in Purok Magtalisay I, Brgy Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She operates two business ventures: fishing and buying & selling livestock. Her husband, Henry T., who is 28 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children aged between 4 and 6. 

Rengie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rengie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,600, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to buy some materials to repair her boat pump. Then she can continue to save additional capital for the business, to pay family expenses and build up savings. Rengie T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida L. is from the city of San Antonio Ozamiz City. She is 52 years old. Aida is married and has 3 adult children. She owns & operates a business, providing sewing services to the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for her store and fish to sell. She can then continue to save for the future expansion of her business. Rowena L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

texts.en:
Paulita C. is from the village of Kinangay Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Paulita is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. Paulita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Paulita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Paulita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas C. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old and is married. Sabas owns & operates an agricultural  business, planting and harvesting Jackfruit for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Sabas joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma N. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She operates 3 business ventures: rice farming, pig fattening and rice thresher rental. 

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 60,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, lifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 24th loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000. She intends to use this as additional capital for her farm and piggery so that she can continue to save for the future education of her youngest child. Norma N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

texts.en:
Allah rakhi lives in the small city of Kasur in the Punjab region of Pakistan. She lives with her family in the area of Dungipura in a 2-room brick house. Allah rakhi, 50 years old, does embroidery to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders from her neighboring customers. She also knits sweaters on order, which earns for her a good profit as well. Allah rakhi has 4 daughters; the 2 elder daughters are illiterate and help their mother in her businesses while the 2 younger daughters study. Allah rakhi"s husband, R. ahmed, operates a weaving business with a power loom (a hand-operated machine for weaving thread or yarn into cloth). His business is located in the market and he earns a good living by selling thread to customers.

Allah rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her knitting business. She plans to use the loan to buy yarn for knitting a larger number of sweaters. Winter season has started and the demand for sweaters has become high. She hopes that she will earn good profits this winter. Allah rakhi is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the photo, Allah rakhi is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy yarn for her knitting business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 32 years old. Evelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

Charity Faith is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Charity Faith from ASKI. loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in Pakistan, in the small city of Kasur, famous for its leather industry. She lives with her family in the area of Dungipura in a 3-room brick house. She moved here after her marriage to M. R. 25 years ago. Rani is a talented woman, operating a clothing sales business from her home. She has a good name in the region due to her choice of fabrics and well-designed clothes. She receives regular orders from her local area clients every month.

Rani is the mother of 2 daughters who are involved in the embroidery business, embroidering clothes on order. Her husband operates a power loom (a hand-operated machine for weaving thread or yarn into cloth) business. He makes threads of different colors on order and earns income for the family.

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to improve her clothing sales business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of clothes in bulk to earn more income. Rani has been running this business for over 10 years and is very confident about its future growth. She is hopeful that the loan investment will help her increase her profits and enable her to collect dowry for her elder daughter's marriage. Rani is a new loan applicant with Asasah.

Note: In the photo, Rani is holding the book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hands.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothing sales business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of clothes in bulk from the Ichra and Shahalmi wholesale markets in Lahore and sell them to her local area clients. This bulk purchasing will minimize her costs of purchasing and traveling.

Zainab, 56 years old, is married to M. S. and has no children. Her husband has a power loom (a hand-operated machine for weaving thread or yarn into cloth) business. Zainab has been operating her clothing sales business for over 30 years and has vast knowledge about the latest clothing trends and fashions. She hopes that an investment will bring many positive changes to her business, enabling her to live better and to save money for the rainy days.

Zainab lives in Kasur, located in the Punjab region of Pakistan, famous for its tanneries. Her home is in located in the small residential area of Dungipura where she has been living since her marriage. Zainab is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client, never missing a single meeting and paying her installments on time.

Note: In the photo, Zainab is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some essential tools

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen’s husband, S. A., runs a business selling cooking oil. He has a shop in the market from where he sells the oil to other grocery stores and to common buyers at cheap rates. Nasreen supports her family financially by doing embroidery. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood who prefer her quality work and give her regular orders every month.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He plans to use the loan to buy cooking oil in bulk to expand his business further. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Nasreen is confident that with the loan investment, his business will definitely improve. Nasreen is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client, always paying her installments on time and never missing a single meeting.

Nasreen is a very helpful person. She lives in Kasur, a small city in Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has lived with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Dungipura for over 20 years. Nasreen has 2 sons and a daughter. Her elder son left his education and started working with his father in his business. Her remaining 2 children are enrolled in school.

Note: In the photo, Nasreen in holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Challenge Group

texts.en:
Samson M. is in his early thirties and married, with one child. Samson has been running a secondhand clothing business for the past ten years. He buys his clothes in the market area of Kariakoo and sells them door-to-door in Karume. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and earns a low monthly profit. 

This will be Samson's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his first loan to increase his stock of clothes and has now successfully repaid this loan. With his second loan, Samson again hopes to refill his stock and ensure that he has enough goods to meet demand for his products. Samson's dream is to one day open his own shop from which he can sell his clothes. 

Samson will share this loan with his loan group Challenge, which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. In the photo, Samson can be seen in the back row in a striped shirt.

loans.use: to increase his stock

loans.name: Dandy

texts.en:
Mr. Dandy E. is from the Barangay of Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, and married to Elizabeth E. a DSWD worker in their barangay. They are blessed with 4 children; 3 are now school aged and the other 1 is still an infant. To make a living, he is presently engaged in driving a motorcycle for hire and  farming activity. He is also presently elected as Barangay Councilor. He’s been engaged in this kind of job for more than 15 years. He is earning an average amount of not less than Php4,500.00 as his monthly income from driving and an honorarium as an official. 

Just this year, Dandy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dandy as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program is now requesting a loan of Php10,000.00 as his 1st loan which will be used for purchasing commercial fertilizer for his rice production activity. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.


 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en:
Amarzaya Z. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Byamba’s wife stays home while the older two daughters attend a local secondary school.  He used to work as a herder in the countryside with 180 livestock. 

At first, he started his business in 2006 by operating a raw materials trading business.  Since 2008, Amarzaya has been operating a car repair business in his town.  Now, he plans to run a taxi service using his car.  In the future, he hopes to buy his own house and therefore he plans to start saving money from now on.  Amarzaya is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to pay for half of the car's purchase price.

loans.use: To pay for half of the car's purchase price.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married and has 5 children. Eduardo is involved in farming and raising pigs. He owns and tills  farmland where he plants rice. His wife helps him sell his harvest at the market. Eduardo also grows pigs for fattening and sale. He says pork meat sells well in his town, especially during special occasions. 

Eduardo needs additional capital to invest in his farm and pigs. He is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 which he will use to purchase feed and farm fertilizers.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en:
Batnasan P. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Hovd province, western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in someone else's yard. 

Batnasan operates a transportation service between local sub-provinces using his own Russian jeep. He began his business in 2008 and has gained a lot of experience since then. He plans to purchase a car in order to start a taxi service within his town using his savings plus the loan which he has applied for from the bank. If he can afford to buy a car, then his wife will be responsible for driving it as a taxi while he maintains his transportation service. 

Batnasan is a modest and hardworking man and says, "I am planning to save more money to buy an apartment for my family in the future." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car which will be used as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his wife to drive as a taxi

Handaa operates a tailoring business out of her home. She started her business in 2007 and has since built a stable operation. She makes tailored clothes according to her customers' requests. In the future, she plans to enlarge her business in order to increase her income and pay for her husband's treatment. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials and fabrics to make clothes for the upcoming Mongolian New Year holiday in order to increase her working capital.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat T., 37, lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family all live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Munhbat and his wife operate a fruit trading business at two different local markets in their town. They has been engaged in this business since 1990, after moving from another town and they have built up a stable and successful operation. 

After many years of owing this business, their earnings have enabled them to buy a house and fence. Munhbat is a modest and hardworking person. He says, “I am planning to build a house in my yard."  Munhbat is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of fruits  at wholesale price from Taikeshken, China's border city.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruit

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
Ivie C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 2 children aged 13 and 10. She is engaged in farming. She helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. Ivie also runs a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells sugar, vinegar, and other kinds of products. She also sells their rice at her store. Ivie wants to help improve her family's living conditions. 

Ivie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ivie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sengee

texts.en: Sengee B. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 5 daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His oldest son has recently graduated from university and is helping with his parents' businesses. Sengee's eldest daughter is a university student, while his two younger children attend a local secondary school. Sengee and his wife own and operate two family businesses selling and trading items such as spare parts and consumer goods in their town. He started his business in 2003 by selling ice cream and other small items, and through this he was able to start his machinery parts trading business with his wife. After many years of successful operation, they were able to expand their business and establish their second business, which is a consumer goods selling business. They sell a variety of common used goods that are imported from Erlian, a border city of China. The couple has built two stable businesses. In addition, Sengee works as a guard in a local government agency to supplement his earnings. In the future, he hopes to continue to grow both of his businesses and says that he is "planning to save enough money in order to purchase an apartment in Ulaanbaatar for my son." Sengee is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his businesses.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en: Tsogzolmaa B. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her husband works in a construction company and her oldest daughter attends university, while her youngest daughter is in kindergarten. She operates a consumer goods trading business. She started this business in 2002 and has since built it into a stable operation. Tsogzolmaa says, "I plan to expand my business and move into my new house which is under construction in the near future". She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell in the countryside in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Jackilyn

texts.en:
Jackilyn E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jackilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jackilyn wishes to have enough income for her family. She does not want her children to experience difficulties.

Jackilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jackilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jackilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 52 years old. Lourdes is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Cory

texts.en:
In eleven years of membership in ASHI, Teresa Dalisay has developed relationships with the other members of ASHI in their barangay. The institution helps her to improve not only her living conditions, but also the social aspects of her life, which is very useful to her and to her funeral homes/services.

Even at 59, her perseverance never fades. When her husband died, she is the one who managed the business and most of her time is spent on her business and with her children. Moreover, she is doing her best to improve her business in order to sustain their basic needs. Through her hardship, courage and industry, her three children have already finished their studies and presently they all have stable jobs. Though her children have their own jobs, she never stops dreaming for their future. She also wants her business to improve in order to help other people in the community by providing employment. She also plans to help her relatives, so that they will become successful someday.

For her next loan, Teresa is applying for PHP 35,000 which she will use as additional capital for her funeral services business. She would like to have a bigger capital base because there are times when she has costumers who can’t afford to buy a coffin in cash, and since she is very considerate she let's her costumers pay for the items in installments. Therefore, a rolling capital will make this more feasible. 

Teresa is now more dignified and happy because there are institutions, like ASHI and its field partner KIVA, which trust and believe in her.

loans.use: For more working capital.

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en:
Togtohbayar B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her older daughter currently attends a local secondary school. 

Togtohbayar sells flour and rice at wholesale. She started her business in January, 2010, and has since built a stable operation within this short period. She hopes to continue growing her business. She says, "My only wish is to provide a good education for my children and to help them become good people." 

Togtohbayar is requesting a 500000 MNT loan to purchase more flour and rice to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and rice

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 27 years old. Lucel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucel owns and operates a general store. Lucel has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lucel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Lucel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken by Lucel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Buajar's Group

texts.en:
Buajar J. is a resident of Uzgen, an ancient and beautiful town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Buajar is the leader of this loan group. She is 47 and married. She and her husband are bringing up four children: three sons and a daughter. The two older sons study at university and the other children are at home. 

Buajar and her husband are farmers. They grow wheat to make a living. They have been doing it for 20 years. In this way they make 1500 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan, Buajar wants to purchase fertilizers and some seeds for farming. In the future, she plans to celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
Narissa C. is from Linao East, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Narissa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Narissa provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Narissa has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Narissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Narissa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which she will use to purchase equipment to improve her business. This will be the ninth loan taken by Narissa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of hers family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Myadagmaa

texts.en:
Myadagmaa B. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling. Her older two daughters both attend a local secondary school. 

Since 2008, she has been operating a slipper-making business, which she has managed to establish as a stable operation. Myadagmaa hopes to continue growing her business and to improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting an 800000 MNT loan in order to purchase more materials and supplies to make slippers.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel R. is from Linao East, Tuguegarao City. He is 38 years old. Samuel is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Samuel provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Samuel has been engaged in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Samuel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the third loan taken by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Moyor

texts.en:
Moyor S. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two adult daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Both his daughters work. 

Moyor operates a small grocery shop. He provides a variety of food products to his customers. He opened his grocery shop in 2003 and has since built a stable operation. For the future, he plans to expand his business so that he can afford to purchase a car for himself. 

Moyor is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat S. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the large city. His daughter attends a local primary school, while his son is in kindergarten. 

Ganbat operates a transportation service. He began his business in 2007 and has since gained significant experience. After several years of hard work, he has built a stable operation. He says, “I work hard every day to expand my business in order to improve my car as well as my house and fence.” 

Ganbat is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan in order to make necessary repairs on his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a thirty-year-old woman, married to a driver, living in a semi-permanent house they own in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is building a permanent house for residence and being able to meet all their basic needs. For seven years she has been in retail and the business is slowly but steadily progressing. She started with an initial capital of eight hundred thousand shillings but now has capital of four million. Her aspiration in business is to become a wholesale trader.

 Rose needs the loan to purchase sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell at her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell at her shop

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Bold B. is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughters all attend a local school.

Bold operates a transportation service between local sub provinces using his own Russian jeep and car. He has been working as a driver since 1990 and started his own business in 2000. He has gained a lot of experience since then. 

After years of successful operation, he was able to purchase a pavilion in the local market where his wife operates a clothing retail business, which  is profitable during winter and spring months. 

Bold is a principled and hardworking man who says, " I am planning to save more money to buy my own house and fence for my family." 

He is requesting a 3000000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics for his wife's business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for his wife's business

loans.name: Nurzada's Group

texts.en:
Nurzada A. is a resident of Tokmok. She is the leader of this group loan. Nurzada is 31 years old. She is an economist and earns money by working as a consultant. 

Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 KGS, Nurzada started to breed cattle. Her brother helps her with that activity. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle and then improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is a married woman who lives in Proper, Brgy. Caigangan, Sta.Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a rice and corn retail business.  Her husband Benito, who is 44 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 11 and 22 years old. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, with which she intends to buy corn and rice to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Erlinda P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more corn and rice to stock and sell to customers

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg C. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd  province, western Mongolia, in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a contractual guard in a local intelligence agency. After graduating from her university majoring in accounting, she started her business in 2009 by selling wool clothing items that are purchased from Goyo company, Mongolian biggest and main wool clothing company. In addition, she works as a salesperson in the local company to supplement her earnings. 

For the future, she plans to continue growing her business and open her own shop. Batchimeg says, " I want to buy my own house and fence for my family." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from Goyo company to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a thirty-three-year-old married man with two children who owns a house and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has a retail shop and has also been into tailoring and knitting for the last four years now. His vision is to own a wholesale business. Edson needs the loan to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale in his shop.

loans.use: Buying sugar, soap, and cooking oil for resale

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit V. is a teacher; she lives in Sevkar village, Ijevan area, with her husband and her two daughters. One of her daughters is a student, and another is a schoolgirl. 

For several years Anahit worked at school as a teacher, but because of marriage and her children's birth, she quit her job. 

In 2003 Anahit opened a cosmetics business which she runs in Ijevan city. At her shop she sells creams, shampoos, hair dye, etc. This occupation allows her to cover part of her family's needs and pay for her elder daughter's education. 

Anahit is askng for a 200,000 AMD loan to buy articles of personal hygiene and perfumes to resell.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada M. is a resident of Tokmok. She is the leader of this group. Aizada is 35 and married. Together with her husband she is raising three children: two sons and a daughter. The daughter and the first son are at school, and the second son is not yet; he is preschool age (under 7).

Delma E. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Delma is married and has 2 school-aged children. loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 24 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child. She owns a piggery. She started raising pigs for fattening 3 years ago. Ailyn also helps her husband at their farm. She plants and harvests rice crops that they sell to the market. Ailyn works hard to be able to save and build a new house for her family.

Ailyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna S. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 48 years old, married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Miraluna owns & operates a  a fishing business. The main source of income for the business is harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Miraluna has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Miraluna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miraluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Miraluna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Miraluna's 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jerima

texts.en:
"Jerima C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 3, Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu . She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: Sari-sari (general) store and ready to wear - direct selling business. Her husband Jonathan C., who is 41 years old, works as carpenter for a living. They have 3 children, ages 11 to 18.

Jerima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jerima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 34000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20000, with which she intends to purchase more stock to sell, so she can continue to save for house renovations in future.

Jerima C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina M. is from the city of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is a 60 year old single woman. To make a living, Cristina raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2005, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be Cristina's 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia C., from the town of Surallah, is 48 years old, married, and has three children aged 15, 14 and 7, all attending school. To help sustain her children's education and meet their needs, she helps her husband maintain their rice farm and also runs a sari-sari store where she sells canned goods and other products.  Because Alicia needs additional farm inputs and products to sell, she is requesting a loan of Php 15000, hopeful that it will be a big help to their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rwenyonyozi Tukore Group

texts.en: T. Wellen belongs to the Rwenyonyozi Tukore group. He is 39 years old and married with 5 children, 4 of whom are in school. Wellen has an agricultural business, selling matooke (a type of banana), beans and coffee. He is helped by his brother and is able to make a monthly profit of 80,000 UGX. He is also involved in building houses as another source of income. Wellen needs a loan in order to purchase and resell more bananas for increased profitability. He is a very hardworking and cooperative man. His future plan is to further reinvest in his produce business and to educate and care for his family.

loans.use: to purchase and resell more bananas

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira A., who is a resident of Tokmok, is the leader of this four-member group loan. A 39-year-old widow, Elmira has two sons, one in school and the other yet too young to attend.

A year ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, Elmira started to take orders and sew Kyrgyz national blankets. Doing this, she makes 8000 soms per month, profits that have made possible the purchase of furniture and improvement of the living conditions. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. In the near future, Elmira plans to purchase a washing machine.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M., from the city of Capatan, Tuguegarao City, is 58 years old, married and has three grown children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 4200 PHP a month.

In 2005, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI, she is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be  Erlinda's eighth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 42-year-old mother of three children whose futures she and her husband work hard to ensure. Maxima is thankful to ASHI for the loans it has provided since 1999 that have enabled her fishing operation to grow through the purchase of a motor boat, fishing net and other business-related materials. She is now requesting a new loan to purchase additional fishing nets and fish cages (traps) and hopes to increase the amount of fish she can sell in the future through hard work and the continuing assistance of Kiva Partner ASHI.

Maxima's membership in ASHI gave her the chance to have her own business. Because of her excellent credit performance throughout her membership in ASHI, from an initial loan of Php5,000 she can now avail Php40,000.00 and could even reach the peak amount available in the future. Therefore, Maxima looks forward to continued business growth through both the loans and the help of her supportive husband, Mamerto, who is her business partner.

When she reaches the highest loan amount that ASHI can offer, she plans to rent a space in the market where she can sell their fish. With the opportunity provided by her membership in ASHI, Maxima can help send their three children to school until they complete college degrees. The couple believes that when they pass away, they will at least have made their business successful and their children can have a business. Maxima’s hard work and patience are her foundation in working to achieve a better life for them.

Maxima is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support of her business endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and fish cages (traps)

loans.name: Myla

Myla P. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 30 years old. Myla is married and has an infant child. In 2010, Myla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Myla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. Myla is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used for additional inventory and as working capital for the business. This will be the second loan taken by Myla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to financially support her family.

loans.name: Forcused Women's Group

texts.en:
T. Catherine is the leader of her lending group, Forcused Women's Group, in Kihihi. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. all in school. She also takes care of other dependents.

Catherine has been operating a hotel and retail shop in Kihihi market for 2 years and she is able to make a weekly profit of 100,000 UGX. Catherine’s customers are mostly within the town of Kihihi. She says that she started her business with capital from agriculture and that she has been able to expand it by being cooperative, friendly and hardworking. Her dream is to be able to expand on a large scale and for her family to develop. Catherine needs a loan in order to restock her business with more foodstuffs for the hotel and general merchandise for the shop.

loans.use: to restock her shop and buy foodstuffs for her hotel

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet C. is from the village of Unidos. She is 25 years old. Janet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janet runs  a general store. Janet has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Janet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the 14th loan taken by Janet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
