loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
In 2004, Rosemarie E. found an opportunity to acquire business capital. She joined ASHI and she was inspired by the stories of other poor women. 

She wanted to become successful like them. Because of the opportunity to take out loans, Rosemarie was able to start a business she thought she could be successful at: fishing. 

She is courageous enough to take all the risks of running this business because her husband is there to support her and because of a dream she keeps in her mind of  having all her children finish their schooling through college. 

Rosemarie has kept on taking loans from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her new loan to buy equipment needed for her fishing business, such as a new boat, fishing nets and other supplies so that her husband will catch more fish to sell. If ever the couple gets better output, they will be able to invest more in their business and in their home.

Rosemarie's only hope is that her children not experience the hard life she and her husband experienced. She dreams of expanding her fishing business. Her long term goal is to build a new, spacious, concrete home to live in.
   
Rosemarie and her husband help each other to achieve their dreams of offering a better life to their children. The couple says thank you to Kiva and ASHI for offering financial support to her business effort.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Zepyur

texts.en:
Zepyur A. was born and spent her whole life near her extended family in the village of Meghrashen in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married and has two children. Her daughter is 22 years old and her son is 24. 

Zepyur has a high school education. She has been a self-employed farmer for the past 15 years. Zepyur considers herself to be a hard-working, sincere person. She is pleased with microfinance loans because they can enable her to grow her business. She is looking for a loan to purchase additional cattle. With this investment Zepyur expects the family income to increase by 25 percent. 

In addition to supporting her family, she provides her relatives with agriculture products from the family farm. Some of the additional income from her business will be used for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mwandila Group

texts.en:
Daniel M. is in his mid-thirties and married, with three children. Daniel has been running a secondhand shoe store since 2007. The business is open from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and earns Daniel a low monthly profit. 

This will be Daniel's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his first loan to increase and diversify his stock of shoes. This loan has now been successfully repaid. Daniel aims to use his second loan to once again increase his stock of shoes and to buy some bricks for the house he is constructing. 

Daniel will share this loan with his loan group Tujijenge Tanzania, which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the photo, Daniel is sitting in the front row.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes and to buy some bricks

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha L. is from the town of Surallah. She is 62 years old and married. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Editha also raises pigs for fattening. loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom A. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the city of Gyumri.  He is the proud father of a five-year-old daughter and a nine-year-old son.  Together with his wife, Artyom runs a small shop selling school supplies and toys.  He has been engaged in this business for over nine years. 

 Artyom has a high school education and hopes one day both his children will attend university.  His dream is to save enough money to purchase his own shop and to grow his business.  

Artyom would like a loan to purchase a broader line of toys and school supplies.  As his business is located in a busy part of town, he expects the family income to increase by around thirty-five percent.  Artyom was born and raised in Gyumri and enjoys living there with his family.

loans.use: purchase toys and supplies

loans.name: Gulaikan's Group

texts.en:
Gulaikan S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok. Gulaikan is 48 and married. In order to earn a living, her husband works in construction. Together they are raising two sons and a daughter.  Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Gulaikan started to cultivate strawberries.  She also breeds cattle to earn more money. 

Gulaikan applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay in order to feed her cattle during the winter season. In the future she wants to see her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.name: Noyemzar

texts.en:
Noyemzar A. is a lifelong resident of Shirakavan.  Shirakayan is located in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with four children.  Her daughter is twenty-four years old.  Noyemzar also has three sons (twenty-six, nineteen and fourteen years old).  She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past twenty years.  

Noyemzar would like a loan to purchase wheat, barley seeds, and cattle feed.  She expects the family income to grow by twenty-five percent with this investment.  Noyemzar’s dream is to renovate the family home.  In addition to supporting her family she also helps her sister with agriculture produce grown on her farm.  She has lived her whole life in Shirakavan and hopes to retire here.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam D. is from the village of Pokr Sepasar in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She has been a very hard-working, sincere farmer for the past forty years.  Mariam is a widow with five children. She has four daughters (thirty-three, thirty-one, thirty, and twenty-two years old).  Mariam’s son is twenty years old.  

Microfinance has helped Mariam grow her cattle breeding business.  She is looking for a loan to purchase additional calves and increase her income by up to forty percent.  She expects to use some of the proceeds of her investment to help pay for her son’s wedding.  She enjoys living in Pokr Sepasar surrounded by her family and friends.

loans.use: purchase calves

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine Ghazaryan lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gharibjanyan.  She has a high school education and dreams of her three children attending university.  Her two daughters are eleven and thirteen years old and her son is four years old.  Together with her husband she has been working on the family farm for the past twenty two years. 

 Microfinance loans have enabled her to grow the business.  She would like a loan to purchase wheat and potato seeds and calves.  According to Marine’s business plan, the investment will increase her income by twenty percent.  She was born in the village of Voskehask and after her marriage moved to Gharibjanyan. She enjoys village life.  Mariam also helps nearby relatives with produce grown on the family farm.

loans.use: purchase wheat and potato seeds and calves

loans.name: Erna

Erna B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 43 years old. Erna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Erna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Erna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Erna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Erna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kairkul's Group

texts.en:
Kairkul A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok. Kairkul is 33 and married. In order to earn money to cover family expenses Kairkul works in the factory and her husband works as a private driver. Together they are bringing up two daughters. Both of them are at school.  

Seven years ago, in order to make additional money for family budget, Kairkul started to cultivate strawberries.  Selling the strawberries she makes 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fertilizers for cultivating strawberries. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for cultivating strawberries

loans.name: Joeylynda

texts.en:
Joeylynda C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old. Joeylynda is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is only 3 years old. Joeylynda is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells in her community. It is her family's source of income so she works hard to keep their farm productive. Joeylynda has been engaged in farming for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Joeylynda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joeylynda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joeylynda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard K. lives in the village of Jajur in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is the proud mother of four children. Her three sons are 31, 29 and 25 years old. Her daughter is 22 years old. Together with her husband she has been working on the family farm for over 30 years. Nvard has a high school education and considers herself to be a hard working, kind person. She dreams of seeing her children to be married with families and hopes to help them purchase homes.  

Nvard would like a loan to purchase additional calves. With proper planning she expects the family income to grow by 20 percent. The reliable services of microfinance loans have helped her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen L. lives in the city of Gyumri.  Gyumri is located in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Armen is newly married; he has no children. He has been working in retail trade for the past two years. Microfinance services have enabled him to expand his business. 

Armen dreams of owning his own store and his own home. Armen and his wife hope to have a big family. He is looking for a loan to purchase more clothes for the business. With this investment, his family income can grow by 20 percent. Armen enjoys living in Gyumri near his extended family and friends.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for retail.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen is a life long resident of Gyumri, located in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is a widower and he has no children. Gurgen has a high school education and has been running a small bakery for the past four years. Previously, he had been employed as a cook.  

Microfinance has enabled Gurgen to expand his business. His dream is to diversify his business in to other food processing goods. Gurgen also helps his extended family with his baked goods. He would like a loan to buy equipment in order to expand his production levels. This investment should increase his income by around 25 percent. He really enjoys being a baker and owning his own business.

loans.use: To purchase bakery equipment.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa Z. is a farmer from the village of Nahapetavan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is happily married and has two sons (28 and 30 years old). She has a high school education and has been raising cattle for the past 30 years.  

With microfinance services, she is looking to grow her business. Larisa would like a loan to purchase additional calves. This investment can increase the family income by 15 percent. Larisa enjoys being an entrepreneur and providing for the family. Larisa also helps her relatives living in the town of Artik.  She is also saving money to help her son pay off his mortgage. She enjoys living in Nahapetayan, surrounded by relatives and friends.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine O. is from the town of Surallah. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child 22 years of age while the youngest is 13 years old. Four of her children are still in school. To fund her children's education, Josephine works hard to earn from her farm. She makes sure her rice crops are healthy and not destroyed by weeds and pests.

Josephine needs to purchase 3 sacks of rice seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. She requested for a loan of PHP 8,000 that she will use to buy the farm supplies she needs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kalbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalbubu I. is the leader of this group. She is 48 and divorced. She has two daughters and a son. Her son works as a teacher and her daughters are married and live separately with their own families. Five years ago, with the initial investment of 1000 soms, Kalbubu started to take orders to sew Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. In this way she makes 4000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials.

loans.name: Nurjan's Group

texts.en:
Nurjan A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmak. Nurjan is 46 and divorced. She has a 21 year old son. Her son works as a security guard. Nurjan works in a hospital. In order to make additional money to cover her daily expenditures, she breeds cattle. She started to breed cattle two years ago with the initial investment of 10000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a bull in order to increase the number of cattle for her breeding program. In the future she dreams to purchase a big house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a bull for breeding.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. is from the town of Surallah. She is 43 years old. Judith is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Judith raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith wants to improve her family's living conditions and she works hard to achieve it.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 55 years old. Julieta is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general store, primarily selling a variety of different products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 54 years old. Manuela is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Manuela owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Manuela also raises pigs for fattening. She sells pork meat to their community. Manuela dreams to have her own car someday. She says nothing is impossible if you work hard for it.

Manuela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Manuela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Manuela is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feeds.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feeds.

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 47 years old. Nancita is married and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 6. To make a living, Nancita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nancita is a hard-working mother and she wishes for her children to be professionals someday.

Nancita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nancita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nancita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and rice and corn seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice and corn seeds.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon C. is from the town of Surallah. He is 57 years old. Ramon is married. To make a living, Ramon owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ramon works hard to provide for all his family's needs. 

Ramon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ramon has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ramon is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Aysel

texts.ru:
Aysel A. 20 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Aysel uchitsya v kolledje i v toje vremya rabotayet chtobi oplatit uchebu.

Aysel uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey produktov. Aysel etomu biznessu nauchilas u teti. Ona prodayet pishiviye produkti , no seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Aysel A. is 20 years old. She is not married and lives in the Absheron region together with her family. Aysel is studying in college and at the same time works to pay for her tuition.

Aysel has been selling food for more than two years. She has learned this business from her aunt. She sells groceries and now needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning products for resale and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy products for resale

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna S. is a mother of four daughters. Her husband is a driver hired by the Ministry of Health. Muna has knitting skills, and started a small workshop in her house serving neighbors and relatives. The returns from Muna's workshop helped her pay her daughters' education expenses.

Muna's oldest daughter is a university student. Muna took a loan from FATEN to pay her daughter's last course tuition fees. This is the second loan Muna has taken from FATEN.

Muna appears in the picture here in FATEN's office

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov B. lives in Vanadzor city. She is a widow and has two daughters who are already married and live separately from their mother. 

8 years ago, Lyubov began to rent a shop where she manages her own business: woman's clothing retail shop. In her shop Lyubov retails skirts, trousers, blouses and outerwear. Her daughter's mother-in-law helps Lyubov in her business and replaces her once a month when Lyubov goes to purchase more merchandise. Now, Lyubov has some coats in her shop which remain from last year, and now she wants to increase her shop’s assortment of coats. Thereto she is asking for a 1,000,000 Armenian drams loan to buy winter jackets and overcoats for her business.

loans.use: To buy winter jackets and overcoats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignment of drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Bahtyzod Karimov's Group

texts.en:
Bahtyzod K. is a resident of Kerben. He is 29 years old, married, and has a newborn daughter. In order to make money to cover family expenditure, Bahtyzod works as a taxi driver. He started in this business four years ago, and now earns 13,000 KGS per month. This profit made has made it possible for him to save money to purchase a piece of land. He has applied for a loan because he doesn’t have enough money to purchase another vehicle. His current car is causing him a lot of problems because it is old and needs frequent repairs. In the future he plans to start building a new house.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a new vehicle

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is an active entrepreneur who manages a sari-sari (variety) store. Her previous loan from Kiva partner, ASHI, provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more inventory. With the previous loan, Consolacion noticed that her monthly income almost doubled because she attracted more customers with her additional stock.
Prior to working with ASHI, Consolacion had no access to capital to support her business dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Consolacion finance her children's education. Since joining ASHI, Consolacion has experienced positive changes in her life and used the additional income to support her family's daily expenditure. She hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family.
Consolacion is now requesting a Kiva loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more foodstuffs for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that her family experiences a life that is full of fulfillment. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Consolacion is hopeful that her business endeavor will provide a steady income and improve her family’s quality of life, which is currently underneath an umbrella of poverty. She hopes that her business will expand so that they are able to make some savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Gulmaya

texts.ru:
Gulmaya T. 41 qod. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey, doch kotoroy 18 let uchitsya v shkole, doch kotoroy 15 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya tancami i sin kotoromu 10 let zanimayetsysa sportom i uchitsya v shkole. Gulmaya i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione.

Gulmaya uje 12 let rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji tovarov dlya nevest. V yeyo magazine ona prodayot Zerkala, svechi, Saxar( ukrashenniy)i t.d eto vse prinyato neveste prinosit s soboy v dom jenixa po nashemu obichayu . Tak kak u nas seychas sezon svadeb Gulmaya  nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  noviy tavar s novimi ukrasheniyami dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Gulmaya T. is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Her daughter who is eighteen is going to school and another daughter who is fifteen is also in school and is taking dancing lessons. Her son is ten and he is in sports and goes to school. Gulmaya and her family live in the Absheron region.

Gulmaya has been in this business of selling bridal products for twelve years now. In her store she sells mirrors, candles, decorative sugar and etc, such things which a bride must bring with herself to the groom's home according to the tradition. As it is the marriage season now, Gulmaya needs 2000 AZN to buy new decorations and items for expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy candles, mirrors, and decorative sugar for resale

loans.name: Aijamal Azimova's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal A. is the leader of this group. She is 49, married, and lives in Toktogul. Together with her husband, she has brought up seven children, all of whom are in school. Aijamal works as a bookkeeper and her husband is engaged in livestock breeding. He started to breed livestock ten years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS. Now he makes 1,500 KGS per month by selling animals after fattening. With this loan the family wants to purchase five animals in order to resell them after fattening. In the future, Aijamal wants to build a big house for her sons.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Pazilat Karahozueva's Group

texts.en:
Pazilat K. is the leader of this group. She is 58 years old and a widow. She lives in Uzgen, a lovely ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Pazilat has raised six children – four sons and two daughters. Most of them are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money, Pazilat cultivates tobacco and rice, and has been doing so since she was 11 years old. By selling some part of the harvest she makes 3,000 KGS per month. With this loan she wants to rent a piece of land for cultivating rice.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more dozens of body creme and head-tie

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of meat

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en: Nemat J.  is a 35 year old man who breeds cattle in the small village of Saatli city. He is married and has three children. Nemat has 3 years experience in this field. Currently he has three cows and his wife actively helps him. He sells milk and milk products to the local people but demand for milk products is higher than his cows can produce and this has pushed Nemat to purchase more cows to generate more milk. Nemat he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN  to purchase more cattle. This will allow him to increase his profit and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Zulfugar

texts.en: Zulfugar M. is a 32 year old entrepreneur who runs his small farm and raises sheep. He is married and has one daughter. Zulfugar has two years of experience in this field and already gained a wide clientele among local butchers. He is not alone in his business as it takes a lot of strength working in the open all year from early morning till late night. Zulfugar's wife actively helps him. Now he is asking for a loan to buy an 10 additional sheep to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of caustic (sodium hydroxide) and palm oil used in the production of soap.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif A. is a 49 year old livestock breeder who raises cattle for meat purposes. He is married and has 6 children.  Arif has four years of experience in this field and now has four head of cattle. He lives and works in the small village of Imishli. Once every three months he takes his cattle to sell at the livestock bazaar. Arif has applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase three baby calves.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim N. has been in the  poultry business since 2008 and already has a wide clientele among local people. Kairm is married and has three children and his wife actively helps him take care of the poultry. Karim buys chicks at profitable prices and then raises and sells them in the livestock bazaar once every three months.  This business is the only source of  income for his family and he put all his efforts into improving his business and generating more income. Now Karim has applied for a 900 AZN loan with the purpose of purchasing more chickens.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh a 30 ans et est marié. IL vit à Bèkpota où il exerce son activté et compte dans cette dernière près de 2 ans. Il est technicien de profession mais associe à son activité principale la vente de l’eau mise en sachet et de cartes de recharges.  Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et à la direction Togo cellulaire, Togo Telecom, Moov. IL sollicite un prêt au près de WAGES pour augmenter son commerce
texts.en: Edoh is 30 years old and married. He lives in Bèkpota, where he has his business and has worked for nearly two years. He is a technician by profession, but his main business has been selling bagged water (similar to bottled water, but less expensive) and prepaid credit for pay-as-you-go mobile phones. He purchases his supplies in the large market of Lomé and, for his phone business, from the companies Togo Cellular, Togo Telecom and Moov. He is requesting this loan from the micro-finance organization called WAGES in order to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase "pure water" (bags of water) and prepaid cell phone credit.

loans.name: Mirneymat

texts.en: Mirneymat A. is 50 years old, married with six children. Being the lone breadwinner for such  a big family is a very hard job but looking after 6 cattle is also a hard job.  Mirneymat wakes up early in the morning to pasture his cows and feed them. All of his day is dedicated to looking after his livestock. He has six years of experience.  His eldest son helps him. He usually sells cattle to the local butchers. Now Mirneymat has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase three baby calves. At the moment he has more orders for meat from butchers than he can fill and this is why he want to enlarge his cattle raising business.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Urbaba

texts.en: Urbaba R. is a 49 year old entrepreneur who has run her own business for the last four years. She is married and has three children. Urbaba currently has three head of cattle and wants to increase the number  to 5. She and her husband work together in the business. Urbaba has applied for a 1000 AZN loan in to purchase two more head of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Yaba Clénam

texts.fr: Yaba a 35 ans et mère d’un enfant. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de son enfant, elle fait le commerce d’huile à moteur. Elle cumule dans cette activité près de 3 ans. Elle s’approvisionne en gros  à Akodessewa et revend à côté de la station  akodessewa en détail. L’objet de ce  crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de 15 cartons d’huile à moteur pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Yaba is 35 years old and the mother of one child. In order to improve the conditions of her child's life, she has a business selling motor oil. She has been in this business for nearly three years. She purchases her supplies in bulk in Akodessewa and resells the goods across from the station of Akodessewa at retail prices. The purpose of this loan is essentially to purchase 15 cartons of motor oil, in order to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used tires

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.ru:
Tamasha H. 42 qoda. Ona zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Tamasha imeyet 2 detey doch kotoroy 19 let ona uchitsya v universitete i sin kotoromu 16 let uchitsya v shkole.

Tamasha uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya prodajey tovarov domashneqo upotrebleniya. V svoyom maqazine ona prodayot kastruli, skavorodki, tarelki  a tak je spalneye bilyo, skaterti i t.d Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye.
texts.en: Tamasha H. is 42 years old. She is married and lives in the Absheron Region together with her family. Tamasha has two children: a 19-year old daughter who is a university student and a 16-year old son who goes to school. For four years, Tamasha has been selling household goods. In her store she sells pots, pans, dishes, as well as bed linen, tablecloths, and so on. She learned this business from her mother. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her facility.

loans.use: Expanding her store facility

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more wood and sticks

loans.name: Agninefa

texts.fr: Agninefa a 37 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il réside à atiégou mais exerce son activité à Akodessewa. Vu l’importance de son activité, il a payé plusieurs crédits déjà et compte dans cette activité 5 ans d’expérience. Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il fait la vente des tôles. Il achète en gros à SOTOTOLE et revend à côté du feu tricolore Akodessewa. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande sans cesse croissante, il sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Agninefa is 37 years old and the father of four children. He lives in Atiégou, but he conducts his business in Akodessewa. He has been in this business for five years and, in view of the importance of his work, he has already invested (and repaid) several loans in his business. To care for his children's needs, he has been selling sheet metal. He purchases the goods at wholesale from Sototole and resells the wares by the traffic lights in Akodessewa. He is requesting this loan in order to best meet growing demands.

loans.use: To purchase sheet metal

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Гиёев Сафарали проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: G. Safarali lives in the Vose region. He's forty-seven years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has bred cattle near his home for eight years. After breeding, he sells the cattle for profit. He's asking for a loan to buy some more cattle.

loans.use: To acquire some cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more banana, oranges, plantain, eddoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla a 27 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur de profession.  Elle est revendeuse de maïs et compte dans cette activité près de 12 ans déjà.  Elle est née à Tabligbo mais habite à akodessewa. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Lomé pour se procurer plus de marchandises. Elle demande un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Abla is 27 years old and married to a man who is a driver by profession. Abla sells maize and has been in this business for nearly 12 years. She was born in Tabligbo, but now she lives in Akodessewa. She purchases her supplies in the towns around Lomé, in order to get more goods. She is requesting this loan in order to better meet increasing demand.

loans.use: To purchase maize

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity U., 30 years old and married to a builder, has four children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, Charity hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to cook and sell

loans.name: Saka

texts.en: Saka A. is 28 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children who both go to school. Saka is currently in the business of selling bananas, onions and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock more onions and tomatoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Basti

texts.en: Basti F. is 50 years old. She sells men's clothes in the Agsu region. She brings the items of clothing from Baku city, which is three hours away from her home. Basti goes to Baku once a month to purchase new stock. She is going to increase her stock by purchasing new seasonal clothes for winter. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She is promising to repay the loan in a timely manner and AqroInvest has every reason to trust her as she has completed her first loan with Kiva successfully.

loans.use: To purchase new seasonal winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Lois D. is 45 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier.She has 3 children. Lois is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Lois hopes to be able to build up a house.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif A. is a 55 years old shopkeeper who has been selling candies, sugar, cookies, beverages and other foodstuffs since 2005. He is married and has 3 children. Vagif would like to increase the number of products he sells and thus be able to improve his life conditions. He is asking for a loan  to purchase more merchandise to increase his  monthly sales.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Sr. Santiago P. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio Virgen del Carmen, tiene 42 años, está casado con la Sra. Gloria, juntos tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar.

        Hace más de 10 años que trabaja como albañil competente en la zona, es muy conocido por su buen trabajo, tiene varios clientes que mediante su esfuerzo y buena predisposición logra.

       Realiza su trabajo con la ayuda de su hermano que le brinda su servicio de ayudante y así poder realizar un buen trabajo.


          Solicita el préstamo para la compra de motocicleta ya que le servirá para el traslado hasta su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago P. is from the city of Carapeguá, Virgen del Carmen neighborhood. He is 42 years old and married to Gloria. They have 3 chidlren together who are school aged.  

He has worked for more than 10 years as a competent brick layer in the area. He is well known for his good work and has several customers through his hard work and good disposition.     

He does his job with the help of his brother who offers his services as an assistant. In this way, he is able to do a good job.       

He is asking for the loan to buy a motorcycle that will be useful for transportation to his job.

loans.use: To buy motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Баротов Курбонали проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: B. Kurbonali lives in the Vose region. He's forty years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has bred cattle for over eight years. Generally, he fattens the cattle and then sells it for profit. He's asking for a loan to acquire some more cattle.

loans.use: To buy some cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more baking flour

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El Sr. Rogelio Dávalos es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañia Veni Loma, está casado con la Sra. Elva tienen hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes.

       Hace varios años que se dedica a la compra y venta de mercaderías (como termos para agua fría y caliente, toallas, sabanas, cacerolas, y otros.) hacia la zona de Lambaré y Tobatí, comenta que tiene más de 100 clientelas formadas que gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación ha logrado.
 
       Los productos que lleva son de buena calidad por lo que tiene buena aceptación.

          Solicita el préstamo para la compra de colchas, pantalones, calzados deportivos.
texts.en:
Mr. Rogelio Dávalos is from the city of Carapeguá, Veni Loma neighborhood. He is married to Elva and they have grown children who are independent.  

 For several years he has bought and sold merchandise (such as thermoses for hot and cold, towels, sheets, casseroles and more) in the area of        Lambaré and Tobatí. He remarks that he has more than a 100 customers thanks to his sacrifice and dedication.  
 
The products he carried are of good quality and well accepted.       

He is asking for the loan to buy blankets, pants, and athletic footwear.

loans.use: To buy blankets, pants, sheets, athletic  footwear and more.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline M.  is in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She is 27 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia  P. sells a local brew from her home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. She is 30 years old and married to a farmer and has two children in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Doña Ramona  tiene 47 años de edad  está casada hace 18 años, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad.  
         La señora Ramona  hace más de 20 años que se dedica a   tejer frazadas y manteles artesanales, ella misma se encarga de venderlos ya que  la mayoría de sus hijos viven por la capital,  viaja una vez al mes y le resulta muy rentable su producto.
         Gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar. 
         Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas ya que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en: Ramona is 47 years old, has been married for 18 years, and has 4 grown children.  For more than 20 years, Ramona has been weaving handmade blankets and tablecloths.  She herself sells them, since most of her children live in the capital.  She travels once a month, and her products are very profitable for her.  Thanks to her work and efforts, she was able to provide her children will all the necessary comforts and an education.  She requests this loan to buy threads and dyes to make hammocks, as they are in great demand by her customers during this season.

loans.use: To purchase colored threads and fabric dyes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. sells onions, tomatoes and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more cans of cooking oil to sell. She is 30 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children, one of whom goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá Cñia. Espartillar, tiene 27 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Mónica León, juntos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad.

    Hace más de 5 años que trabaja como vendedora ambulante en varias comunidades vecinas, manifiesta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientela formada ya que sus productos son de buena calidad y aceptación.

   Comenta que semanalmente lleva productos ya sea como electrodomésticos, calzados deportivos y productos artesanales.

       Solicita el préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos, calzados deportivos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel S. is from the city of Carapegua Cnia. Espartillar. He is 27 years old and married to Mrs. Monica Leon. They have two small children.

He has been a street vendor in various communities in his area for more than 5 years. His products are of goof quality and his many costumers are happy with them. Every week he offers products like small household appliances, sports shoes and local crafts.

Mr. S. has requested the loan to buy household appliances and sports shoes.

loans.use: To buy electric household appliances, sports shoes and the like

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa R. sells onions, beans and tomatoes at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and groundnuts to sell. She is 42 years old and married to a farmer. She has 5 children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao S. is 28-years-old, married to Ipanoi Ene Mpakwanik and the father of four school-going children. For the past six years he has been growing wheat on his own piece of land.

Patao learned about KADET from a colleague who was already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan which he will use to purchase and prepare more land and buy chemicals and fertilizer. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy animals to fatten and later sell at a profit.

His dream is to buy a bigger piece of land and become a commercial producer. Patao is hard working, and with the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To purchase more land and prepare it for planting and buy chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 27 years old and married to Jane Muthoni. He operates a car-hire business in Kiambu town, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi city. This has been his primary business for the last year. Kiambu is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population as well, which is favorable for any business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member and this will be his first loan with KADET. He has no previous credit history as he has not borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, Bernard plans to take his vehicle for servicing and replace any worn-out parts. He knows that when his car is in good condition, his clientele will also be more loyal to him.

He hopes and desires to expand his business and be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: Bernard wants to use this loan to maintain and service his car, which is used for hire.

loans.name: Alice Nayausupat

texts.en:
Alice Nayausupat K. is 28 years old. She is married to Koileken Lagama and she is a mother of three school-going children. Alice is a farmer and she has been farming on her own piece of land for the last 13 years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness campaign done by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to spend 50,000 Kenyan shillings to prepare the land for wheat planting and to buy seedlings for the same. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat in a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will be doing commercial farming. She believes she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: Preparing the farm and buying farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty M. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim (sesame) and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim and charcoal to sell.  Betty is 37 years old and married to a peasant. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of simsim and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Paskalin

texts.en: Paskalin A. is 37 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom attend school.  Her husband is a builder.  Paskalin is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sold in the restaurant.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sold in her restaurant

loans.name: Wilson Adjeley Ja

texts.fr: Madame wilson adjeley A. est couturière de profession .elle est diplôme de l'institut de coupe coupure perfectionnement de Togo.elle a commence son commerce des le bas age .elle a eu prendre un prêt qu'elle a solde.elle veut un nouveau pour augmenter son fonds de roulent et satisfaire sa demande.
texts.en: Mrs. Wilson Adjeley A. is a seamstress by profession. She is a graduate of the Togo school of cutting, sewing and advanced training. She started her business at an early age. She previously obtained a loan, which she fully repaid. She is now seeking a new loan to increase her working capital and meet customer demand.

loans.use: Sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar and onions to sell

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Tavapygua Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Kyrey, se conformó en fecha 20 de julio del 2007 con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 9° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familiares en especial. 
 Una historia muy conmovedora la de la Sra. Petrona S. quien se dedica al comercio al por menor, nos comenta que mediante el Crédito y la asesoría recibida pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administración.
 Ella posee un salón en su domicilio donde cuenta con gran variedad de mercaderías con precios muy accesibles, y ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoro bastante ya que actualmente poseen además del ingreso de su marido quien trabaja como albañil.
 Según la Sra. Petrona menciono que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que pudimos desarrollar nuestras capacidades de trabajo, además de levantar nuestra autoestima como madres trabajadoras.
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como aceite, fideos, arroz, y otros.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women named “Kuna Kyrey started on July 20th, 2007 with a lot of enthusiasm and effort. It is in its ninth cycle. Each member works independently but they share a joint fund and help each other to reach their goal of helping their families financially.

One special story is Mrs. Petrona S.’s, who works in retail sales. She shared that through loans and guidance she has been able to increase her sales. She has a retail store with different kinds of merchandise which she sells at reasonable prices. This has increased her household income which is in addition to her husband’s salary as a construction worker.

It is her opinion that the activities performed with the Paraguaya Foundation are important because through them the members have been able to develop their abilities and build their self esteem as working mothers.

The loan will be used to buy products like oil, pasta, rice and the like.

loans.use: To buy oil, pasta, rice and the like

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more Jerry cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Fredrick Moses Simpiri

texts.en:
Fredrick Moses Simpiri M. is 23 years old. He is married to Leitato Sopia and he is a father of two school-going children. Fredrick is a businessman involved in the selling of livestock.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more animals for fattening to later sell them at a profit. He hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his business and become a commercial animal seller.

Fredrick's dream is to do well in the business and start dairy farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy more animals for fattening to later sell at a profit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther G.  is 32 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  Her husband is a builder.  Esther is currently in the business of selling different types of fish at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and onions to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Meiponyi

texts.en:
Meiponyi K., 27 years old, married and a father of six school-going children, has been a maize farmer in Narok area for the last four years. Maize normally does well in this area due to good climatic conditions, and he hopes that this will be true in the next planting season as well.

Meiponyi learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare land for maize planting. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Meiponyi's dream is conduct large scale farming and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land for maize planting.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine T.  is currently in the business of selling various items in the shop such as sugar, cartons of salt etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar, rice and beans to sell.  Christine is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man.  She has 2 children and her children both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: photographe de profession monsieur matar S. a très tôt quitter l'école pour se consacrer a la reproduction des photos;une activité qui marche fort au senegal.il a eu prendre un prêt qu'il a solde avant échéance et sollicite un nouveau pret pour augmenter son fonds de roulement.
texts.en: A photographer by profession, Mr. Matar S. quit school early to devote himself to photo reproduction, a popular activity in Senegal. He previously obtained a loan which he repaid before term. He is now seeking a new loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To strengthen photo reproduction business

loans.name: Naitaiyuang Enole

texts.en:
Naitaiyuang Enole P. is 28 years old and married to Tonou P.. She is the mother of six school-going children. Naitaiyuang is a maize farmer in the Narok area and she has been doing farming for profit for the last 12 years.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to spend 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) to prepare the land for maize planting and Kshs 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Naitaiyuang's dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: Preparing land for maize planting and buying seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To tock bags of rice, beans, and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora A.  is 25 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  She is currently in the business of selling fish, ground nuts, and simsim at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock bags of ground nuts and simsim to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up store for her goods.

loans.use: To stock bags of ground nuts and simsim to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian M. W. aged 33 years old is married to Francis Mwangi and they have been blessed with three children. She runs a tailoring and mobile accessories shop in Shanzu, Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last ten years. She also has a stake in the building industry as she is a landlady with some houses on rental.

She has applied for her second loan with KADET and she plans to purchase iron sheets to renovate her rental houses. The anticipated profits will be directed to her children’s education.

Her dream is to become prosperous in future.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets and renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una joven de 28 años , ella es soltera aun vive con sus padres , son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que con la ayuda de sus hermanos que se encuentran trabajando en el exterior ( España)  , ella logro estudiar una profesión,  es maestra de primaria , ella actualmente trabaja en una escuela en la comunidad de Vilomilla , el sueldo que percibe es de $US 186 al mes  lo cual no alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos que ella pueda tener , ya que además su madres es de 65 años y ya no trabaja por lo tanto Alejandra tiene que ayudar con los gastos de la casa , entonces el sueldo que percibe es muy bajo  , lastimosamente con la situación de la pobreza en Bolivia los sueldos de todos los  maestros son bajísimos.

Alejandra vive en Sipe Sipe en la comunidad de Viloma Grande, el préstamo será destinado para la compra de semillas de Flor, puesto que invertirá para la producción de Flor (gladiolos), debido a que no le  alcanza su sueldo ella realizara otras actividades para poder ayudar a su madre y cubrir todos sus gastos. Ella estuvo trabajando en esta actividad pero ahora quiere hacerla crecer.

Entres sus sueños y metas de Alejandra es crecer en su actividad produciendo flores, tener una casa propia en la ciudad de Cochabamba, para cuando tenga hijos le pueda ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a 28-year-old young person. She is single and lives with her parents. They are a family with scant economic resources. They receive help from her brothers who are working outside of the country (in Spain). Alexandra has been able to achieve a profession as a primary school teacher. She works at a school in the community of Vilomilla. She earns $186 per month. This salary doesn’t cover her expenses. Her mother is 65 years old and can’t work. Alexandra needs to help with the household expenses. The salary that she earns is really low. Sadly, with the poverty that is in Bolivia, the teacher’s salaries are really low.
Alexandra lives in Sipe Sipe in the community of Viloma Grande. This loan will be used to buy flower seeds. The seeds will be used to grow gladiolas. Since her salary doesn’t provide enough money, she needs to do other activities in order to help her mother and pay their expenses. Alexandra has worked in this business but now she would like to expand it.
As for her dreams and goals, Alexandra would like to grow her business of flower production. She would like to have her own house in the city of Cochabamba. She would like to have children and would like to offer them a better life.

loans.use: She will buy seeds in order to grow flowers

loans.name: Familia Group

texts.es:
El Banomunal Familia inicia su quinto ciclo con 11 socias, Teresa es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal Familia, tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Teresa tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, venD. todo tipo D. producto D. primera necesitdad. Teresa inició su negocio debido al flujo D. carros para la salida Vía Los Libertadores, que es la carretera D. salida D. Ayacucho hacia Lima, empezó vendiendo caña y coca, poco a poco comenzó a surtir su tienda, ahora venD. abarrotes en general como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, detergente, jabones, papel higiénico, aguas gaseosas, aguas D. meza, entre otros y frutas.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. panteones, leche, chocolate, ahora que se viene la campaña naviD.ña.
A Teresa le gustan las reuniones D. su bancomunal, las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora le han eneseñado a ahorrar y le ayudan mucho en su vida diaria. el sueño D. Teresa es que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Banomunal” Family has begun their fifth cycle of loans with eleven members in their group. Teresa is the president of the Family Community Bank. She is 49 years old, married and has four children.
Teresa has a grocery store. She sells all types of basic food products. She started this business at the off ramp of “Los Libertadores” Street. This is the road that connects Ayacucho to Lima. She began her business by selling sugar cane and cocoa. Little by little she began to proviD. a greater variety of products. Now she sells general grocery items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, detergent, soap, toilet paper, sodas, bottled water and fruit.
The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy Christmas sweet breads, milk and chocolate as the Christmas season is approaching.
Teresa likes the meetings of the community bank. The training that she receives from the teacher has taught her how to save money and has helped her with her daily life. Teresa dreams that her business will continue growing.

loans.use: She will buy Christmas sweet bread, chocolate and coffee.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es artesano, realiza trabajos de artesanía en cotillones de cartulina, esponja, para acontecimientos sociales (en Bolivia denominamos cotillones a todos los productos como piñatas, mixturas, serpentinas, etc., que usan para adornar en los acontecimientos sociales).
Es viudo y todos sus hijos son independientes.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de, cartulina, esponja, cola, y papel para continuar su negocio. 
Es la décima primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la sexta vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Arturo lives in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is an artisan. He makes party decorations for social events out of foam core and cardboard (in Bolivia parties include products such as piñatas, confetti, streamers, etc. that they use to decorate for social occasions). Arturo is a widower and all his sons are living on their own.
This loan will be used to buy cardboard, foam core, paste and paper in order to maintain his business.
This is his eleventh loan that he has requested from Impro and the sixth time he has asked for support from KIVA. His background qualifies him as a good borrower and he always pays his loans on time.

loans.use: He will buy cardboard, foam core, and paste for his business of making party decorations for social events.

loans.name: Umuco Ii Group

texts.fr:
Elie N. est un commerçant âgé de 30 ans qui habite la Commune Rugombo en Province Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de boisson, un métier qu’il exerce depuis 4ans. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 5e année de l’école primaire. Il est marié et il a 5 enfants dont 2 sont a l’école. Il  arrive au 5e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boisson à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il pourra assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.  

Il  est un des membres du groupe  communautaire« Umuco II»
texts.en:
Elie N. is a 30-year old merchant living in the Rugombo Community in the CIbitoke Province, in the East of Burundi. He sells beverage, a business he has been in for four years. He has stopped his schooling after the fifth grade of primary school. He is married and has five children, two of whom go to school. He is now on his fifth community loan with Turame.

He is seeking a loan from Kiva in order to increase his capital in purchasing large quantities of beverages for resale, which will allow him to grow his savings. He hopes that, with the savings made possible through this loan, he will be able to provide for the basic needs of his family and pay school fees for his children.
He is a member of the community group “Umuco II”.

loans.use: Increasing his capital by purchasing large quantities of beverages for resale, which will allow him to grow his savings

loans.name: Medelina

texts.en: Medelina M. is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She is currently in the business of selling ground nuts and maize flour.  She is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki A. A. is a 33 year old lady who is married to Yusuf Karama. Riziki sells ladies accessories and cold drinks, and this has been her business for the last six years with success.

This is her second loan with KADET and she plans to buy more ladies' accessories (bangles, rings, earrings, etc.) in preparation for the festival and holiday season. She will use the future anticipated profits to boost her cold drink business.

Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' accessories for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K., aged 40 years, is a business lady in Kasarani who runs a hardware shop. She is married to Solomon K. and together they have a daughter aged 18 years and in high school. Susan has been running this business for a period of one year and her monthly income is Kshs 50,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office, and she has applied for a loan of Kshs 30000 loan, which she will add to her income and buy more floor and wall tiles, toilet seats and covers. She is hopeful that the investment will bring in more profits, which she will use to increase her stock to grow her business further.

Susan dreams of becoming a distributor in building materials and eventually start importing hardware materials. This will help her educate her daughter to the university level and empower her to be self-reliant.

loans.use: To increase her stock of floor and wall tiles, sinks, and toilet seats.

loans.name: Sungura Group

texts.en:
Abraham N. is in his early thirties and is married with three children. Abraham runs a small phone accessory and spare parts store and has been doing that since 2007. The shop is open between 7:30 am and 9:00 pm and earns Abraham a low monthly profit. 

This will be Abraham's 8th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Abraham used his previous loans to increase his stock of different spare parts, as well as improve the condition of his stall. These loans have all been successfully repaid. With his 8th loan, Abraham aims to invest in some used phones and beginning selling them as well. Abraham's dream is to one day own a big mobile phone store. 

Abraham will share this loan with his loan group Sugura, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Abraham can be seen 2nd from left in the first row, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To start selling mobile phones.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	



Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupé. 
Son mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas que gracias al crédito que les ofrece la Fundación están pudiendo crecer en sus negocios y así ayudar al sustento de sus familias.
 Ellas están muy agradecidas por la confianza y por el apoyo que se les brinda porque gracias a ello están pudiendo mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
El comité ha culminado su ciclo crediticio número 16, hace aproximadamente 4 años que trabajan con la fundación.
Una de las integrantes, es la señora, María quien de dedica a la elaboración  y venta de chipas, en su casa cuenta con los hornos donde se realiza la cocción, que son calentado a leña que ella compra de personas que se dedican a esa actividad.
La elaboración de los mismos lo realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su familia y además de la venta que ella realiza tiene también vendedores particulares.
Comenta que la venta de chipas la ayuda bastante y es prácticamente único ingreso de su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos, como leña, almidón, quesos, grasas, y otros.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the San Francisco neighborhood in the city of Caacupé.  

They are very hardworking and self-sacrificing women, and thanks to their Fundación loans they can grow their businesses and help support their families.  

They are very grateful for the trust and support they get because it enables them to make life better for themselves and their families.

The committee has been working with Fundación for four years and has completed its sixteenth loan cycle.  One of its members, María, earns her living making and selling chips.  She cooks them in her house in ovens she heats with wood she buys from others.  

She works every day with help from her family, and she's got vendors to sell her product, too.  She says the chip sales help her out quite a bit and are practically the only source of income her family has.  She is seeking a loan to buy supplies like firewood, starch, cheese, oil, etc.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make chips.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. M. is a 23 year old single man. He has been in the mali mali / barter trade business in Kongowea for the last two years. He normally exchanges items like wash basins, utensil holders and kitchen wares for newspapers, old clothes and shoes, which he later sells or repairs to sell at a profit.

This is his second loan with KADET, which he plans to use to purchase more stock of the items for exchange with his clients. 

He in future he wants to start another business, and his dream is to live happily and get a family that he can be able to provide for as well.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for sale and trade in his bartering business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock beans and more onions to sell

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 25 years old and married to Tabitha Wanjiru. He sells secondhand clothes as well as new clothes for men. The clothes range from shirts and trousers, which are both official (business) and casual wear. This has been his primary business for the last four years in an area called Ngara within Nairobi town. The area is normally very busy in terms of business and has a high population as well, which is favorable for any business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his second loan with KADET, and he has not borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, Geoffrey plans to buy designer clothes and also open another stall for his wife to run.
 
He hopes and desires to open another stall and be able to import clothes from Dubai and China.

loans.use: Geoffrey wants to buy new clothes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Mariscal Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Mariscal Santa Cruz” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha reunido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por once integrantes.
