Los negocios son diversos: tejido y venta de periódicos, venta de detergentes, venta de comida, venta de pescado, tejido y venta de verduras, venta de comida, panadería, taller de metal mecánica, tienda carnicería y confección de deportivos.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Rosalía es una mujer joven de 24 años, madre de un niño ingresó a formar parte de la banca comunal porque necesitaba capitalizarse para llevar adelante su negocio de venta de comida.  La señora Rosalía vende comida en la zona de Tilata los días martes y viernes de 7:30 a 14:00, por ahora trabaja sola.    Su préstamo solicitado es por Bs.1000.- y será invertido en la compra de arroz, papa y otros.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la reunión que se tiene en el centro focal.
texts.en:
The “Mariscal Santa Cruz” community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  This is a new group which has come together to receive loan services, training and health services.  It has eleven members.  The members' businesses are all different: knitting and selling newspapers, selling detergents, selling food, selling fish, knitting and selling vegetables, selling food, bakery, metal workshop, butcher's shops and making sports shoes.

The president of the community bank, Rosalía, is a young woman of 24.  She has one child and joined the bank because she needed working capital to carry out her food sales business.  Rosalía sells food in the Tilata district on Tuesdays and Fridays from 7.30am to 2.00pm.  For now, she works alone.  She is requesting a loan for 1,000 bolivianos and she will invest the money in buying rice, potatoes, etc.

When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the meetings which take place in the regional office.

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo N. is a 43-year-old married man who has seven children. He operates a retail shop in the Sita area situated in Malindi. He normally sells cooking fat, soaps, bread, tea leaves, and other items in his retail shop.

Mr. Charo was introduced to KADET LIMITED by one of the company’s existing clients. He is now taking his second loan, which amounts to Kshs 40,000, and he plans to expand his business with it by buying more stock and repairing the business premise. Charo hopes that, by doing this, the business will grow and he will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support his family.

In the future he hopes to own a flourishing supermarket.

loans.use: To sustain and grow his business running a general store.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La señora  Bernardina se dedica a la producción D. leche y quesillo, entregando en la zona y otros centros aledaños sus productos, pero tiene la oportunidad D. perforación D. pozo en MallcoRancho, donD. tiene un terreno, el terreno tendrá riego y D. esa manera generara ingresos por la siembra D. maíz y cebolla. Por eso tiene suma importancia la compra D. una acción D. riego lo que determinara D. forma directa mayores niveles D. vida, pues la zona en la que vive es una zona agrícola y no ha podido sembrar mucho por el problema d escasez D. agua en esa zona. 
La Señora Bernardina comprara la acción para el pozo D. agua para riego, para que sus terrenos realmente le empiecen a generar ingresos y no sean terrenos secos.
texts.en:
Bernardina has a business producing milk and 'quesillo' (a soft cheese).  She delivers her products locally and also delivers to some surrounding areas.  However, there is an opportunity to drill a well in MallcoRancho where she has a plot of land.  Her land would thereby have irrigation and so make more income as she would be able to grow corn and onions.  For this reason, buying a share in the irrigation system is extremely important as it will directly improve her living conditions.  The area in which she lives is a farming area but people have never been able to grow much as there has been a scarcity of water in the area.

Bernardina will buy a share in the irrigation well so that her land can really begin to generate income and not remain dry.

loans.use: To buy a share in an irrigation well

loans.name: Patemo Group

texts.en:
Nassoro M. is in his early forties and is married with three children. Every day he runs a school bus service for children, and while he waits during the day, he runs a store from which he sells drinks and snacks. Nassoro has been running the business between 04:00 am and 11:00 pm daily since 2006, and it earns Nassoro a low monthly profit. 

This will be Nassoro's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Nassoro used his first loan to increase his stock of juices and sodas. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With his second loan, Nassoro aims to once again increase his stocks of goods, primarily juice and soda. 

Nassoro will share this loan with his loan group Patemo, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Nassoro can be seen wearing an orange and black T-shirt and standing on the far right.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of soda to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John N. is a 36 years old, married, and has five children. John has a masonry business, which has been in existence for four years. He primarily operates his business in the Gede and Watamu area where most of his clients live.

This is the first loan John is requesting from KADET after being introduced to the company by another client. He is asking for a loan for  5,000 KES and he plans to use it to buy more working tools for his business.  John wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue educating his children and providing for his family.  He hopes that one day his business will grow big enough to enable him become a sought-after mason.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Changamkeni Group

texts.en:
Robert J. is in his early thirties and is married with two children. Robert has been a butcher since 2007. The butcher shop is open between 11:30 am and 8:30 pm and earns Robert a good monthly profit. 

This will be Robert's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. With his previous loan, Robert increased his stock of meat and enjoyed a healthy level of capital in the business. With his second loan, Robert aims to open a new location in another part of the city.

Robert will share this loan with his loan group Changamkeni, which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Robert can be seen wearing white and blue on the far right in the front row.

loans.use: Increase his stock of meat.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed D. is a 42-year-old married man who was introduced to KADET LIMITED by another client already registered with us. Mohamed operates a farming business whereby he gets to raise livestock, which he later sales to other clients in different areas at a profit. His farm is situated in Malindi where he stays with his family. 

This is his first loan with KADET, which he intends to use to buy more livestock for fattening on his farm and to later sell. The anticipated profits will be used in taking care of his family and reinvesting in his livestock business.

Mohamed hopes that one day he will get to own a bigger farm and be able to practice mixed farming.

loans.use: Buy more livestock for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía A. de la ciudad de Caacupé.
 Son mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras, muchas de ellas cabezas de familia. 
Están muy agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la Fundación, gracias a los créditos y las constantes capacitaciones que reciben están saliendo adelante, están pudiendo ayudar al sustento de sus familias, e ir creciendo comercialmente.
El comité ha culminado su ciclo crediticio número 10, están teniendo una línea de crédito por encima de los un millón de guaraníes, y cada vez se unen mas señoras con ganas de salir adelante, que escuchan del programa y que ven como las antiguas están aumentando sus ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rosa quien de dedica a la venta de cosméticos. 
Ella trabaja en la venta de sus productos sobre pedido, y ofrece mediante catálogos que posee de los productos que ella vende.
Más adelante desea abrir una botique donde puede ofrecer además de cosméticos, ropas y calzados. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos que desea compra ya que recibió muchos pedidos especialmente de perfumes.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from A. in the town of Caacupé.

They are very hard-working, determined women.  Many of them are heads of families.  They are very grateful for the financial support and trust which Fundación Paraguaya is providing them with.  Thanks to the loans and the constant training which they receive, they are managing to get ahead in life and are able to support their families and grow their businesses.

The committee members have just finished their 10th loan cycle.  They now have a line of credit of more than one million guaranís and more and more women keep joining their committee with a desire to get ahead in life.  They listen to the program and see how the existing members are increasing their incomes and thereby improving their quality of life.

One of the members is Rosa who sells cosmetics.  She sells her products to order and offers them through catalogs which show the products she sells.  In the future, she would like to open a store where she can offer clothes and footwear as well as cosmetics.  She is requesting her loan so that she can buy cosmetics as she has a lot of orders to fill, especially for perfume.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Royarn

texts.en:
Royarn K. is a 24-year-old single man who operates a tailoring shop in Malindi in the Kwandomo area of Kenya. He was introduced to KADET LIMITED by one of our existing clients. He is now taking his first loan of 21,000 KES which he will use to buy a modern sewing machine and materials needed in his business.

Royarn hopes that by taking this loan the business will grow, and he will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support his people as well as expand the business even more.

In the future Royarn hopes to own his own tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine and other materials

loans.name: Nuru-Lumu Group

texts.en:
Charity D. is in her mid-forties and is married with three children (in the picture, Charity can be seen in the back row wearing a yellow scarf). Charity runs both a general store as well as a poultry business in which she raises roosters. She has been in this business for the past six years. Charity's store is open between 12:30 P.M. and 10:00 P.M. and earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Charity's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Charity used her first loan to increase the stock for her store, and she used the second loan to increase her rooster population. Both these loans have now been successfully repaid. With her third loan, Charity aims to buy more rooster chicks to further increase her rooster population to 200.

Charity will share this loan with her loan group Nuru-Lumo, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

loans.use: To buy more rooster chicks

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Bancomunal Musuq Wasi, tiene 38 años, es madre soltera con un hijo varon de 11 años.
Flor comenzó con la crianza de animales menores como son los cuyes, su casa está al costado de un grifo ahí decidió abrir una tienda y poco a poco comenzó a surtir su tienda, vende abarrotes en general, pollo, carne , verduras y aguas gaseosas.
El crédito que  solicita Flor lo invertirá para comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, huevos, jabones, detergentes.
Desde que ingresó a Finca, su vida cambio, con los prestamos anteriores que ha recibido ha podido surtir su tienda. A Flor le gustan lasreuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, en la capacitaciones aprendió a ser puntual responsable, a cuidar su salud y familia.  
El sueño de María Flor, es que su negocio crezca, y que su familia constituida por su padre e hijo siga unida con la bendición de Dios.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the Musuq Wasi Communal Bank.  She is a 38 year old single mother, and she has an 11 year old son.  Flor started raising small animals like guinea pigs.  Her house is on the side of a gas station, and that is where she decided to open a store.  Little by little she began stocking her store.  She sells general groceries, chicken, meat, vegetables, and carbonated water.

The loan that Flor is requesting is to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, eggs, soap, and detergent.

Ever since she became a member of Finca her life changed.  With the previous loans that she has received she has been able to stock her store.  Flor likes her communal bank meetings because she is able to save.  She also likes the trainings in which she learned to be punctual, responsible, and how to take care of her health and her family.

María Flor’s dream is that her business grows and that her family, comprised of her father and son, continues on together with God’s blessing.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
la señora Delia Es una cliente que tiene terrenos con riego  permanente de la Cuenca Viloma y de dos pozo de riego en la misma zona, por lo tanto es una productora de choclo, zanahoria y cebolla de calidad en forma semestral. Actualmente requiere agua para cultivar mayor extension de terreno cultivable y de esa manera generar ingresos para mejorar su vivienda y nivel de estudios de sus hijos.

Ella necesita comprar una accion de pozo para esta zona (zona de Viloma Grande) nueva para cultivar sin problemas mas choclo, pues su produccion se encuentra peligrando por la escasez de agua, debido a la sequia que esta afectando a todo el sector agricola.
texts.en:
Delia is a client who has land with permanent irrigation from the Viloma Basin and from two irrigation wells in the same area.  Consequently she produces quality corn, carrots, and onions every six months.

She currently needs water to cultivate a greater extension of arable land.  She will do this to generate income to improve her house and her children’s level of education.  

She needs to buy access to a well for this new zone (Viloma Grande zone) in order to grow more corn without problems.  Her production is in danger from the scarcity of water due to the drought affecting the entire agricultural area.

loans.use: Compra de accion para pozo

loans.name: Nkaate

texts.en:
Nkaate O. is 32 years old. He is married to Napilosh Kasale and he is a father of two school-going children, aged 5 and 18. Nkaate has been a tomato farmer for the last five years.
  
Nkaate learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his third loan. He is planning to spend 35,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for his tomato farming and with the other Kshs 15,000, he will buy some sheep for fattening to later sell at a profit. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of tomatoes.

Nkaate hopes to become a large-scale farmer, both in tomato farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and chemicals for tomato farming and to buy some sheep for fattening to sell later

loans.name: Yorina

texts.es:
Yorina es socia del Bancomunal Musuq Wasi, tiene 25 años, es casada, todavia no tiene hijos.
Yorina decidió abrir una tienda porque por la zona donde vive no había, hasta ahora le va bien, tiene clientela. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, huevo, harina entre otros, para surtir su tienda, pues asi tendra mayor aceptacion su negocio.
Le gusta Finca porque le dan crédito y puede ahorrar, ha aprendido a ser responsable, puntual le gusta también las capacitaciones de la familia y negocios que recibe de su promotora.
texts.en:
Yorina is a member of the Musuq Wasi Village Bank.  She's twenty-five, married, and doesn't have children yet.  

She decided to open a store because there wasn't one in her area.  It's going well so far and she's got clientele.  She plans to use her loan to buy merchandise including rice, sugar, noodles, oils, milk, eggs, flour, etc., to stock up her store so it will be more widely used.  

She likes Finca because she gets loans and can save money.  She's learning how to be responsible and on time.  She also likes the professional and family development sessions she gets from the Finca staff.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda is 30 years old and a mother of five children. She owns a retails shop and she has been in this business for six years. Her business has helped her to be able to identify loyal customers and she has also gained a lot of business experience skills.  

This is her first loan with KADET LTD after she joined. She would like to use it improve the capacity of the business by adding more stock like cooking fat and flour. She hopes to get back good returns from this investment.

loans.use: Improve the capacity of the business by adding on stock

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora S. M. Lourdes tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres en el barrio 3 de mayo de esta ciudad de Tarija. S. M. Lourdes  es madre soltera tiene una hija. S. M. Lourdes  se dedica al comercio de verduras actividad que viene realizando desde hace mas de 6 años esta actividad la realiza en el mercado campesino.                                                                                                                                                                                                      
S. M. Lourdes quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarle una mejor vida a su hija pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar mas mercadería es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
S. M. Lourdes  nos cuenta que quiere darle a su hija toda la comodidad que pueda para que sea feliz, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para la compra de un  lote de terreno.
texts.en:
S. M. Lourdes is 25 years old and lives in her parents' house in the 3 de Mayo neighborhood of the town of Tarija.  S. M. Lourdes is a single mother and has one daughter.  S. M. Lourdes sells vegetables, a business which she has had for more than 6 years.  She sells in the country market.

S. M. Lourdes would like to make more income to provide her daughter with a better life.  She tells us that she would like to buy more merchandise.  Her loan will be used to buy more merchandise so that she can improve her income.

S. M. Lourdes tells us that she wants to provide her daughter with all the comforts that she can so that she is happy.  For this reason, she says that her next loan will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: James Tajemuo

texts.en:
James Tajemuo M. is 32-years-old.  He is married to Koitoi Kerema and he is a father of one child who is five years old.  James is a wheat farmer who has been doing this for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.  This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend on his twenty acres of wheat farm to buy seedlings, plant, spray fertilizers and harvest in the current season.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes, build some rental houses and buy his own tractor.  Despite his age James believes he is hard working and he will achieve his set goal.

loans.use: To invest in his wheat farm for the current season.

loans.name: Edita Pastora

texts.es:
Edita de 60 años, tiene un puesto de venta de encebollados y guatita (dos platos típicos que se comen en el desayuno). Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Desde joven ella trabajo haciendo comidas para poder ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus siete hijos. Comenzó con la ayuda de su hija mayor vendiendo en una carretilla encebollado (platos elaborado con pescado, cebollas, yucas)  y también Guatita (elaborado con las tipas de vaca y plátanos). En la actualidad continúa con su negocio levantándose a las 03h00 para iniciar con la preparación de los platos hasta que termina y lleva la comida a un puesto en la calle para venderlos hasta las 14h00pm. 

Para seguir con las ventas de los platos ella quiere comprar yucas y pescado para hacer más platos. En el futuro quiere tener un local propio y tener mayor rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Edita is 60 years old.  She has a stall where she sells 'encebollados' and 'guatitas'.  Both of these are traditional breakfast dishes.  She lives in Playas canton which is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations, noted for its wide variety of seafood.

Edita has been selling meals since she was young in order to help cover the school expenses of her seven children.  She began, with her eldest daughter's help, selling 'encebollado' (a dish made from fish, onions and cassava) and 'guatita' (a dish made from tripe and plantains) from a cart.  She is continuing in her business.  She currently gets up at 3.00am to start preparing her dishes and, when she is finished, she takes the food to her street stall and sells until 2.00pm.

She would like to buy cassava and fish so that she can continue selling her dishes.  In the future, she would like to have her own premises.  She would also like her business to be more profitable.

loans.use: To buy cassava and fish

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan K. is 33 years old and supports five members of her family. Joan is a widow with two children, aged 10 and 7 years respectively. She sells secondhand clothes to residents of Kabarnet town, and this has been her business for the past 4 years. She gets a monthly income of Kshs 6,000.  

She has a borrowed a loan of Kshs 35,000 as her second loan from KADET LTD, and she will use the loan to buy more stock of the secondhand clothes ranging from trousers and blouses to baby clothes. She plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to expand the business and save some for the education of her children. 

Joan hopes to be able to have more capital to start selling new clothes and shoes in her shop and also build a family house and give her children the best education.

loans.use: Add more stock of clothes to her business

loans.name: Urugero Group

texts.en:
Viviana is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband is a farmer. Viviana is a leader of the borrowing group called Urugero, which means Example for Others, in Kinyarwanda. Viviana sells beans and she has had this business for about four years. The group members sell different commodities at the local marketplace. 

Viviana has requested this loan to buy more beans to sell. She hopes to buy a house from the profits. In the future, she would like to have stock which is valued at 1,000,000 RWF and a shop of the same value.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.en:
Genovefa is 39 years old and married to a house builder. She has five children who are between 2 months and 13 years old. Three of her children go to school. Genovefa is the leader of the borrowing group called Haguruka CB.  In Kinyarwanda, this means "Let’s stand up". The group is composed of both men and women who sell different items but all of them came together to request the loan which will support them in their various businesses. 

The group leader, Genovefa, sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for four years. She has requested this loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell and she says that with the profit from this business, she will re-invest in her inventory and provide food for the family.  In the future, she would like to own a motorbike for transportation and a shop.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola M. is a 53-year-old single lady who has nine children. She sells fish in Chafisi, Malindi. Her customers are mostly residents from within Chafisi where her business is situated.

She was introduced to KADET LIMITED by one of the company’s customers, and she is taking her second loan from KADET. She plans to buy more stock of fish for her business with the loan and be able to get more returns. 

Pola hopes to grow her business in the future to be able to educate all her remaining young children up to the university level.

loans.use: Buy more fish stock ro resell

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is three months old. Her husband works as a farmer. Seraphine sells a variety of merchandise in her shop and she has been doing this business for one year. She would like to get this loan to buy more milk, bread, pineapple, rice, and saucepans to sell. She is proud of her business because it has allowed her to purchase land for cultivation and other basic needs. The profit from this business will be used to help with the family expenses. She hopes to own a big shop and a milling machine in the future.

loans.use: To buy more milk, bread and rice to sell.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Las señoras que componen este comité son muy sacrificadas, trabajan arduamente en sus respectivos negocios y con el esfuerzo diario sacan adelante a sus familias.

Las Señoras hoy en día cuentan con un pequeño capital para poder aumentar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

Ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguay por tan importante apoyo que les está brindando.
Las Señoras del presente comité son del Barrio San Blas, hoy están en el Ciclo Número 2º programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras con una antigüedad aproximada de 5 meses.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rossana quien se dedica a la venta de lencería.
La manera en que ella trabaja es la de ofrecer sus productos mediante visitas hasta sus clientas, este trabajo lo realiza en sus horas libres, y comenta que le gusta mucho ya que le deja buena ganancia.
Quiere continuar hasta llegar a abrir su propias tienda en su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de lencerías  ya que para la temporada de mucha se acerca.
texts.en:
The ladies who make up this committee are very self-sacrificing.  They work hard in their respective businesses and, through the hard work they do every day, they get their families ahead in life.

These days the ladies have a little capital with which they can increase their incomes and their quality of life.

They are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the important support which they have given them.

These ladies are from San Blas neighborhood.  They are currently in their 2nd loan cycle in the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program.  They have been together for approximately five months.

One of the members is Rossana who sells lingerie.  She visits her customers and offers them products.  She carries out her work in her free time and she tells us that she likes it a lot because it makes her good profits.  She would like to keep going until she can open her own store in her home.  She is requesting this loan to buy underwear as a key sales season is approaching.

loans.use: To buy lingerie

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Neiva Maricela

texts.es:
Neiva de 29 años, cría y vende pollos. Vive con su hijo en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 6 años se dedicaba a criar pollos pero por falta de capital dejo el negocio y si dedico a otra cosa. Pero hace un año atrás ella retomo el negocio de los pollos con unos ahorros que tenia porque son rentables y les gusta criar animales comestibles. Ahora tiene un criadero de pollos en su casa y su mama le ayuda a darles la comida en la mañana a los pollos desde las 06h00am hasta que ella atiende a su hijo de 9 años para que vaya a la escuela. Trabaja en las tardes hasta las 20h00pm vendiendo los pollos grandes que pesan de 6 a 7 libras. Para tener más ingresos ha comenzado a vender artículos plásticos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos para tener más animales para vender y plásticos para tener otra fuente de ingreso. En el futuro quiere tener su propia casa y tener un local para vender pollos.
texts.en:
Neiva is 29 years old.  She raises and sells chickens.  She lives with her son in Playas canton.  This is one of Ecuador's tourist destinations and it is noted for it wide variety of seafood.

Neiva began raising chickens 6 years ago but because she lacked capital she left the business and turned to something else.  However, a year ago she returned to her chicken business with some savings which she had built up because it is a profitable business and she likes raising animals.  Now she has a chicken nursery in her home.  Her mother helps to feed the chickens in the mornings at 6.00am because Neiva has to look after her 9 year-old son and gets him off to school.  She works in the afternoon until 8.00pm selling the big chickens which weigh 6 – 7 pounds.  To make more income she has also started selling plastic goods.

Neiva will use her loan to buy chickens so that she has more animals to sell and also plastic goods so that she has another source of income.  In the future, she would like to have her own home and have premises from which she can sell her chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens and plastic goods

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 4 años, Georgina se ha dedicado a vender cosméticos D. diversas marcas, reconocidas en el mercado, desD. entonces ofrece productos para el cabello, maquillaje, y cremas, esto D. acuerdo al pedido del cliente. Su estilo D. venta es dejar la mercadería a crédito, sin embargo es agotador cuando tiene que salir a la casa D. sus clientes ha realizar las respectivas cobranzas, sabe que es parte del sacrifico y esfuerzo del trabajo, pero vale la pena ya que al final ve las ganancias que recibe y eso le hace sentir satisfecha con la actividad que realiza. Para ella lo más importante, son sus hijos, por lo que espera poder ayudarlos en la culminación D. sus estudios. Ahora continuará esforzándose en la venta D. cosméticos con miras a  incrementar más su capital D. trabajo. Es crédito numero 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la adquisición D. cosméticos, D. esa manera podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Georgina is fifty-one and lives with her husband and their four children in her own house.  For more than four years Georgina has earned her living selling a variety of well-known brands of cosmetics, taking orders for hair products, makeup, and creams.

Her business model involves leaving merchandise on credit. However, it's exhausting to have to go to her clients' homes to get paid.  She knows it's part of the effort and sacrifice of the job, but it's worth it since she sees the profits she brings in, so she's satisfied with what she does.  Her kids are the most important thing to her because she hopes to be able to help them complete school.

Now she plans to keep pushing herself in her cosmetics sales, with an eye toward increasing her working capital.  This will be loan number eight with MFP, and Georgina is glad to know that she's got financial support.  In addition, it's a pleasure being part of her village bank because all the members are responsible and stick together.  She appreciates all the people who will proviD. the loan she is seeking, since the loan will be a big help in her business's progress.  She plans to invest her loan in cosmetics so she can meet demand.

loans.use: Adquirir más cosméticos.

loans.name: Adrian Wilder

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Adrian; el tiene 43 años de edad, casado y tiene 1hijo; el socio se dedica al alquiler de su carro (camión), el lo alquila a las personas que lo requieren, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa siendo este el medio para sacar a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro.

 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Adrian belongs to the “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Adrian is 43 years old.  He is married and has one child.  His business is hiring out his vehicle (a truck).  He hires it out to people who need it.  He works together with his wife and this is how they get their family ahead.

He is requesting this loan so that he can have maintenance work done on his vehicle.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Jenny  Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Jenny; ella tiene 43 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza, la socia es consultora de la línea Avon , Esika, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de plantas ,vendiendo a sus amistades. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza como cremas, shampus, perfumes entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Jenny is 43 years old.  She is separated and has one child.  She buys and sells Avon and Esika beauty products.  She also sells plants.  She sells to her friends.

She is requesting this loan to buy more beauty products such as creams, shampoos and perfumes.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products such as creams, shampoos, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.es:
Santa de 50 años, tiene una pequeña papelería. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Escogió tener una papelería para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hijo pequeño ya que él es obrero de planta y el dinero no es suficiente. Poco a poco con esfuerzo  comprar diversa papelería e incremento el espacio para una mejor atención también ha puesto rejas por la delincuencia que hay (aparece en la foto). Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm vendiendo cuadernos a $ 1.25, plumas a $ 0.30, hojas a $ 0.04 c/u. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería y otros artículos para su papelería. En el futuro quiere si hay posibilidad agrandar el loca y con mas mercadería
texts.en:
Santa is 50 years old.  She has a small stationery store.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Duran which is located on the outskirts of Guayaquil.  It is known for its deteriorating ecosystem.

Santa chose to have a stationery store so that she could help her husband with the expenses of their young son since her husband works in a factory and his money isn't enough.  Little by little, with hard work, she bought stationery products and increased her space so that she could provide better service to her customers.  As can be seen in the photo, she also put up bars because of the crime in the area.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm selling exercise books for $1.25, pens for $0.30 and sheets of paper for $0.04.

She would like to use her loan to buy exercise books, pens, stationery items and other articles for her stationery store.  In the future, if possible, she would like to expand her premises and stock it with more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy toys and exercise books

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se ha dedicado al transporte público, siendo su esposo el conductor del vehículo, en la que es propietaria. Desde entonces cubren las rutas locales de su ciudad, María administra las ganancias, y parte de eso lo invierte en un cafetín, servicio que ofrece en el interior de un centro educativo. Manifiesta que le es rentable las actividades que realiza,  es por ello que procurará establecerse estos trabajo, además de darle mantenimiento mecánico continúo a su vehículo. Es el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago de mantenimiento y renovación de licencia de  conducir.
texts.en: María is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in their own house.  She has worked in public transportation for over three years.  Her husband drives the vehicle and she is the owner.  They cover the local city routes and María manages the finances, some of which she invests in a small cafe inside a school.  She shares that these businesses are profitable, and for this reason wishes to continue with them, as well as do continual vehicle maintenance.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy to know she has financial support and is thankful to be part of a community bank because the members are all very responsible and united.  She will use the loan money to pay for car maintenance and to renew a driver's license.

loans.use: To renew driver's license

loans.name: Raul Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raul; El socio tiene 28 años de edad, el socio es soltero y el trabaja independientemente en cada obra que se le presente, el es arquitecto; el socio ahora está ahorrando su dinerito para poder poner su estudio y pagar sus alquileres el también amoblará y comprará todo lo que requiere un estudio de arquitectura poco a poco. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos materiales de arquitectura y ahorrar para poder pagar alquileres de una nueva oficina.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the Sacsayhuaman Community Bank located in the Huanchac district of Cuzco. Mr. Raul is 28 years old, single, and works independently on every job that is presented to him. He is an architect and is currently saving his money to have his own studio and pay the rent. Little by little he will also furnish the studio and buy everything an architectural studio needs. He is asking for the loan to buy some architectural supplies and to save to pay for rent in a new office.

He is thankful and values the loan provided through these means and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To buy architecture supplies and to save to pay rent in a new office

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Abel; el tiene 40 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 04 hijos; el socio se dedica  la carpintería, él trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa, el socio realiza trabajos acabados en madera como camas, puertas,estantes,armanrios entre otros.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de carpintería.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Abel belongs to the "Granito de mostaza" (Mustard Seed) Community Bank located in Cuzco.  He is 40 years old, lives with his partner, and has four children.  He works in carpentry alongside his wife.  He crafts products such as beds, doors, shelves, wardrobes and others.  He is asking for a loan to start a carpentry business.  He is thankful for all those who help make his dream come true through these means and promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To start a carpentry business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 30 años y su vida la comparte en compañía de su esposo y su hija en casa de unos familiares. Desde hace 5 años ofrece el servicio de fotocopiadora, asimismo pudo adquirir un computadora, desde entonces ofrece el servicio de redacción de documentos, sin embargo ella quería tener más ingresos, así que aprovechó el local que tiene para vender artículos de oficina y golosinas. Manifiesta que esta muy contenta de contar con el apoyo de su esposo, ambos han logrado desarrollar este negocio. En la actualidad, este negocio se mantiene estable, lo cual le ha permitido cuidar de su hija pequeña. Su mayor propósito es implementar su negocio de  maquinaria nueva para ser más eficiente en el trabajo. Es el crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a topas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de papel al por mayor y de mercadería para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a very entrepreneurial woman. She is 30 years old and shares her life in the company of her husband and daughter in a relative's home. For 5 years she has worked offering a photocopying service and in this way was able to buy a computer. Since that point she has offered typing services. However, she desired to increase her earnings and so she used her business to sell office supplies and snacks.

She shares that she is very happy to be able to count on the support of her husband. They both have been able to develop the business. This business is currently stable, which has allowed her to care for their young daughter. Her greatest goal is to furnish her business with new machines to be more efficient while working.

This is her ninth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She is thankful to be part of her community bank because all the members are very responsible and united. She thanks all the people who will loan her the money she requests as it will be very useful to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy paper in bulk and other merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: Paper and office supplies for her business

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rolando; El socio tiene 38 años de edad, el socio es soltero y el trabaja de forma independiente, reproduciendo pinturas en lienzos desde hace 15 años, el socio realiza replicas con acabados extraordinarios y estas copias son vendidas, el socio desea comprar materiales de trabajo como son pinturas, pinceles, lienzos para plasmar nuevos cuadros, generalmente realiza trabajos de vírgenes, santos, paisajes y escenas católicas; el socio es todo un artista y la gente conoce su trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de pinturas.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the Sacsayhuaman Community Bank located in the Huanchac district of Cuzco. Mr. Rolando is 38 years old, single, and has worked independently reproducing paintings on canvas for 15 years. These replicas are extraordinarily done, and then sold. He desires to buy supplies for work like paint, brushes, and canvas for making new paintings. His normal work is of virgins, saints, landscapes, and Catholic scenes. He is quite an artist and people are familiar with his work. He is asking for a loan to buy painting materials.

He is thankful for and values the loan provided him through these means and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: Painting materials

loans.name: Gladys Miriam

texts.es:
Gladys de 44 años, da sur servicios como enfermera y ginecóloga en una zona periurbana. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en un lugar que está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Desde que era joven le gusto ayudar a la gente para que mejoren sus vidas. Cuando entro a la universidad decidió especializarse en ginecología para no solo ser doctora sino ayudarle a la gente que no puede tener un tratamiento médico en donde ella vivía. Ubico su negocio en “Bastión Popular” de servicios de enfermería y ginecología a unos valores muy económicos. En la actualidad da sus servicios como doctora en un local que tienen en su casa y en la zona de “Bastión”. También ayuda a las mujeres que quieren superarse y no han tenido la posibilidad de tener un estudio enseñándoles a realizar chequeos médicos y planificar sus vidas familiares.   

Para seguir ayudando a las mujeres ella quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de enfermería y ginecología. En el futuro quiere abrir un nuevo consultorio en el sur de la ciudad ya que es ahí donde está la mayor parte de gente que no ha tenido oportunidad de superación.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old.  She provides her services as a nurse and gynecologist in a peri-urban area.  She lives with her husband and two children in a place in Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area which is surrounded by a salt marsh.

Since she was very young, Gladys has always liked to help people to improve their lives.  When she started university she decided to specialize in gynecology.  She didn't just want to become a doctor but also wanted to help people where she lived who couldn't afford medical treatment.  She set up her business in “Bastión Popular”, providing nursing and gynecological services at very affordable prices.  She currently provides her services as a doctor in premises which are located in her own home and in the “Bastión” area.  She also helps women who want to improve themselves and haven't had the opportunity to study, teaching them to perform medical check-ups and plan their family lives.

In order to continue helping women, she would like to use her loan to buy nursing and gynecological materials.  In the future, she would like to open a new doctor's office in the south of the city since that is where most people who haven't had the opportunity to improve themselves live.

loans.use: To buy nursing and gynecological materials

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 1 hijos; La socia se dedica a trabajar en el poder judicial, ella es trabajadora del poder judicial, ella trabaja como asistenta judicial, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para mantención de su casa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Progreso” communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  Luz Marina is 32 years old, divorced, and with one son.  She is a legal assistant who works from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM.  It’s through this work that she gets ahead with her son and she wants to improve her work skills.

She is asking for this loan in order to perform some maintenance on her home.  She is grateful to those persons who will help make this dream possible through this means and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Yris Madeleine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Iris; ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la crianza de pollos , la socia tiene su granja hace ya un par de años,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora conmuchas ganas de seguir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas insumos para su negocio como maíz,verduras,purina ( comida para pollos). 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Granito de Mostaza” (Grain of Mustard) communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  Iris is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  She has a farm and has been raising chickens for two years.  [Iris] is a very entrepreneurial woman with a great desire to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more supplies for her business, such as corn, vegetables, and chicken feed.

She is grateful to those persons who will help make this dream possible through this means and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Chicken feed

loans.name: Rosa Karina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Rosa Karina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a trabajar en el poder judicial, ella es abogada, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en el aspecto laboral. La socia solicita el préstamo para el estudio de sus hijos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Progreso" communal bank, located within the district, province, and departmetn of Cusco.

 Karina is 30 years old, married and has three children.  She is an attorney, works from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM and manages to help her children get ahead.  She would like to continue improving her work.  She is asking for this loan to pay tuition for her children's schooling.

She appreciates those who have helped to make her dream a reality through this means and is committed to making all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Tuition for her children

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a alquilar equipos de sonidos desde hace 5 años para todo tipo de reunión, fiestas desde infantiles, quinceañeros, matrimonios, actividades y mucho más. La socia desea el crédito para comprar micrófonos y luces de sonido. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Sacsayhuaman" communal bank, located within the Huanchac district, within the province, and departmetnt of Cusco.

Felicitas is 32 years old, married and has four children.  She rents out sound equipment for all types of social gatherings, such as children's parties, quinceañeras, weddings, and many other things.  She has been in this business for five years and is asking for this loan so that she can buy microphones and sound lights. 

She appreciates those who have helped to make her dream a reality through this means and is committed to making all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Sound equipment

loans.name: Josue Omar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Josue Omar; el tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de ejecutivo de ventas, el trabajo desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, el por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Progreso" communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

 Josue is 42 years old, is single and has one son.  He is a sales manager and works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 daily.  He gets ahead with his son through his work and wants to continue improving.  He is asking for this loan in order to perform maintenance on his home.

He appreciates those who help him achieve this dream through this medium and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Angel Remigio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Josue Omar; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de policía, el trabaja particularmente porque es cesante de la policía nacional del Peru, el socio quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the "Progreso" communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Josue is 58 years old, is married and has four children.  He is a police officer who works for private entities because he is a former member of the Peruvian National Police.  He wants to open a grocery store and is asking for this loan in order to make some improvements to his home.

He appreciates those who help him achieve this dream through this medium and he is committed to making his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Esther; ella tiene 50 años de edad, soltera,la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de chompas de alpaca distrubuyendolo a los comerciantes minoristas que le solicitan, a la vez también la socia teje algunas chompas para venderlas a sus amistades.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar más su negocio de chompas de alpaca.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the "Granito de Mostaza" [Little Grain of Mustard] Village Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  

Esther is fifty-years-old and single.  She earns her living buying and selling alpaca sweaters, distributing them to retailers who order them.  She also has some that she sells to her friends.

She is seeking a loan to expand her business.

Esther appreciates everyone who is a part of her dream and she promises to make all her payments on time.

loans.use: Esther is seeking a loan to expand her alpaca sweater business.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a la artesanía la socia repara niños de yeso, ella trabaja desde hace 20 años reparando niños manuelitos, la socia trabaja junto a sus conyugue y son muy cotizados en estas épocas navideñas, la socia desea el dinero para poder comprar todos los materiales y continuar con sus trabajo para tener listos  a los niños manuelitos para la noche de navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y pintura de color piel para reparar a los niños de manuelitos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the “Sacsayhuaman” Communal Bank, located in the Huanchac district of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 2 sons.  She is dedicated to her artisan craft, repairing plaster dolls.  Alejandrina has spent nearly 20 years repairing child-like dolls called “manuelitos”.  She works with her husband and their work is much in demand during Christmas season.

Alejandrina requests this loan to purchase all needed materials, including skin-color paint, in order to continue her work and have the “manuelitos” ready for Christmas Eve.  She appreciates and values the loans available through this means and, at the same time, she commits herself to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS AND SKIN-COLOR PAINT FOR REPAIRING CHRISTMAS DOLLS

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: La Señora Carmen Alicia S. O. es una persona joven pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de churrasquitos  tiene un comedor y venta de ropa típica, agradece grandemente a Fape por otorgarle un crédito Kiva ya que le ha ayudado mucho para agrandar su negocio pudiendo invertir más en su local de ropa como en su comedor y ahora vende productos de consumo diario, y ha logrado captar más clientes ya que en un solo lugar pueden  encontrar diversos productos que ella les ofrece; por lo que el día de hoy ella solicita un nuevo crédito Para comprar productos de comestibles  y asi poder surtir mas si tienda, todos los días  desde muy temprano junto a su niña de tres  años ella se encamina al mercado municipal de un pueblo llamado San Juan Sacatepéquez, donde tiene su negocio  y empieza sus labores diarias donde está desde el amanecer hasta el anochecer lo que le ha llevado al éxito en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a young woman with a strong desire to succeed. She works selling grilled meats. She has a store with a dining area where she sells local cuisine. She is very grateful to her field partner FAPE for giving her a Kiva loan, which has helped her grow her business by enabling her to invest in her store. Now she also sells groceries, enabling her to attract more customers since they can find many product offerings in one place.  

Carmen requests a new loan to buy groceries so that she can restock her store. Every day, alongside her three year old daughter, she walks to the market in a town called San Juan Sacatepéquez, where she has her business. She begins her daily chores at dawn and works until to dusk. This is what has led to the success of Carmen’s business.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Carmen Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Carmen Josefina; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a trabajar como secretaria, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere seguir estudiando para salir adelante y mejorar como secretaria y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y aceite para su casa.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen Josefina belongs to the "Progreso" Village Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She's twenty-five, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She works as a secretary from 8AM to 6PM.  She would like to keep going to school so she can get ahead and become a better secretary so her kids can succeed.  She is seeking a loan to buy basic necessities like rice sugar, and oils for her household.

Carmen Josefina appreciates those who are taking part in her dream by funding this loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Carmen Josefina is seeking a loan to buy basic household necessities like rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Ober

texts.es: Ober tiene 32 años, vive con su esposa y su hija en su casa que es propia. Desde hace más de 5 años, se ha dedicado a ofrecer el servicio de construcción de inmuebles. Desde entonces, trabaja entre el ladrillo y el cemento, levantado pared y techando. A lo largo de estos años ha logrado ganar experiencia en este trabajo, por lo que ahora tiene prestigio entre los clientes y eso le favorece para trabajos futuros. Hoy puede contrata la mano de obra de albañiles, quienes le ayudarán en esta actividad, por lo que él se encargará de la supervisión y asegurar que todo el proyecto de construcción termine bien. Este trabajo le ha permitido capitalizar rápidamente sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida por lo que seguirá  trabajando en este rubro con miras a crecer en la calidad de su servicio y en la adquisición de nuevos clientes. Es el crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas de construcción y madera que le sirve en estos trabajos.
texts.en:
Ober is thirty-two and lives with his wife and daughter in a house he owns.  For more than five years he has been in the real estate construction business.  He works with brick and cement, building walls and doing roofing.  Over the years he has managed to gain experience in his industry so now he's got prestige among his clients, which bodes well for him for future jobs.

Nowadays Ober can hire bricklayers, who help him on the job; he supervises and makes sure the projects get done well.  This work has allowed him to build up his income quickly and improve his quality of life; he'll keep on working in the field with an eye toward growing the quality of his service and gaining new clients.  

This is loan number ten with MFP, and Ober is very glad to know that he has financial support.  He also appreciates being part of his village bank because all the members are responsible and tight-knit.  In addition, he appreciates everyone who will loan to him it will be such a big help to the progress of his business.  He plans to invest his loan in constructions tools and wood to use on the job.

loans.use: To buy tools and wood for his real estate construction business.

loans.name: Juana De Fatima

texts.es:
Juana de 31 años, es enfermera y vive con su esposo y tres hijos en una casa que es de ladrillos y que contiene como servicios básicos agua y luz. Vive en un lugar que está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Ella es enfermera su trabajo lo hace en su casa tomando la presión de sus clientes, inyectándolos, identificando algún dolor etc.  Su esposo es cobrador aunque los dos trabajan todavía sus hijos no están estudiando y viven en el patio de la casa de la mama. Para poder mantener a sus hijos ellos construyeron una pequeña casa en la parte del patio de la casa de la mama ya que ella vive en una que es muy pequeña. Para tener una mejor vida ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, pinturas y bloques para que sus hijos vivan cómodos. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un lugar especifico donde pueda practicar con tranquilidad enfermería.
texts.en:
31-year old Juana is a nurse and lives with her husband and three children in a brick house which has the basic services of water and electricity. Their home is located on Guayaquil’s Perimetral highway, an area surrounded by a salt march.

Juana works as a nurse out of her house. She takes blood pressure, does injections, diagnoses illnesses etc. Her husband is a bus conductor. Although both of them work, their children are not yet at school. In order to have a home for their children, they live in Juana’s mother’s yard where they have built a small house. She also lives in a small house there. So they can have a better life, Juana wants to use the loan to buy cement, paint, and blocks so the children can have a more comfortable home.

In the future she wants to finish building her house and have a dedicated calm location where she can practise nursing.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, and blocks

loans.name: Santa

texts.es: Santa tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo, su hija y su nieto en su casa que es propia. Toda su vida ha estado dedicada a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, a lo largo de más de 30 años, siendo el sostén familiar. Ahora no tiene responsabilidad alguna, que solo se dedica a la agricultura, en donde siembra maíz y papa, lo cosechado es utilizado para el consumo diario. Pero lo que mas le genera rentas, es la venta de animales, que previamente son engordados por varios meses, luego son ofrecidos en el mercado mayorista en las ferias ganaderas a un mayor precio. Santa afirma que gracias a esta actividad le ha permitido sostener a su familia, y por tal continuará adelante con el fin de intensificarse. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.
texts.en:
64-year old Santa lives with her husband, daughter, and grandson in their own house. She has been a farmer and owned livestock all her life, supporting the family for more than thirty years. Nowadays she has no responsibility other than her farm where she grows corn and potatoes. The money she earns from the produce is used for daily expenses. A more profitable venture is the sale of animals which have been fattened for several months and then sold in the wholesale market at livestock fairs for a good price.

Santa explains that it is thanks to this work that she has been able to support her family, and she wants to strengthen this side of her business. This loan is her second with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very happy to know that she can access this kind of financial support. She is grateful to be part of her community bank because all the members are responsible and committed people.

She wishes to thank all those who donate money to her loan as it will be very useful in the development of her business. She plans to buy a bull with the money.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Aquilina Estela

texts.es:
Aquilina de 40 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura. Vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 14 años  en un lugar que está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

En el momento de la separación de su esposo y cuando tuvo problemas económicos decidió empezar a coser la ropa de sus vecinos para tener dinero y poder mantener a sus dos hijos. Pero como necesitaba más ingresos decidió recorrer las calles de la Babia (mercado de ropa que cubre 7 cuadras) para busca clientes potenciales de almacenes. Con dedicación en la actualidad tiene una persona que le ayuda a coser la ropa y a repartirla a sus clientes en la Bahía. Ella hace pijamas de dormir, camisas, pantalones etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar rollos de telas y hilos para confeccionar más ropa. En el futuro quiere contratar más personal para hacer con un mayor volumen la ropa.
texts.en:
Aquilina, age 40, operates a sewing workshop. She lives with her two children (ages 18 and 14) in a place located along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil that is surrounded by a marsh.

When she started having financial problems during the time she separated from her husband, Aquilina decided to start sewing clothes for her neighbors in order to earn money to support her two children. Whenever she needed extra income, she would walk the streets of Bahía (a clothing market that covers seven blocks) in search of potential customers. With dedication, Aquilina now has an assistant who helps with sewing the clothes and making deliveries to her customers in Bahía. She makes pajamas, shirts, trousers, and other types of garments.

With this loan, Aquilina wants to buy rolls of fabric and thread for making more clothes. In the future, she wants to hire more staff so that she can produce a larger volume of clothing.

loans.use: Purchase rolls of fabric & thread

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 64 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos y nietos en su casa que es propia. Hace más D. 8 años que tiene una tienda, instalada en el interior D. su casa, ya que gracias a la ubicación que esta cerca D. una avenida hay mucha afluencia D. gente. Cada día trabaja en la atención D. su tienda y su esposo la apoya en este trabajo, ya que recibe mayores entradas durante las fechas festivas D. su localidad como: fiestas patronales, fiestas patrias, día D. los santos, etc. Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer su negocio, es por ello que siempre esta al pendiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda con nuevos productos, D. esa manera se mantiene activa en el negocio. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, porque le gusta atender a su clientela, es por ello que continuará trabajando con la proyección D. implementar su puesto D. venta. Es el crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece asimismo a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para seguir incrementando su mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Teodora, 64, lives with her husband, her two children and grandchildren in her own house.  She has had a store for over 8 years in her home.  Thanks to her house’s location very near an avenue there is a lot of foot traffic.  She works in the store every day; her husband helps her since her sales are best during local festivals such as: patron saint day, national days, all saints’ day, etc.

Teodora takes advantage of every opportunity for her business to grow; she is always on the lookout for ways to innovate and improve her store with new products and this is how she stays active in the business.

She enjoys her work very much because she likes to take care of her customers so she intends to continue working with the aim in mind to better stock her sales stand.

This is her 10th loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.  

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested funds to continue to increase stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To increase the variety of stock items in her store.

loans.name: La Concepcion De Santiago Group

texts.es: En esta foto se muestra al grupo llamado la Concepcion de Santiago el cual está ubicado en la comunidad de Santiago Miahuatlan en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.En la forografía se muestra la actividad comercial a la que se dedica la sra. Maria Del Rosario H. A. Que es la compra y venta de los siguientes productos: bolsas de colgar hechas de material reciclable, servilleteros, servilletas, canastas, recuerdos infantiles tipo alajeros y portaretratos los cuales estan fabricados de madera, tiene un año que se dedica a esta negocio, la venta la realiza de forma ambulante en mercados, parques o lugares públicos, dice que ya es conocida por mucha gente que le compra sus productos y las ve satisfechas pues le dicen que estos estan muy bonitos, los da a buen precio y les gusta la variedad de productos que lleva.  Esta clienta es de nuevo ingreso comenta que es la primera vez que adquiere un credito de este tipo, hoy esta contenta y agradece la confianza otorgada, dice que este credito lo destinará a la compra de mas mercancia y las ganancias las invertira en otro negocio que tiene en mente, colchas y cobertores para esta temporada. Ella tiene el firme proposito de hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a tener buenas ganancias y a si lograr el proyecto de poder terminar de construir su casa que por una u otra razón no ha logrado y está segura que con la ayuda de los prestamos a futuro logrará esta meta. Ella tiene 52 años y estudió hasta sexto grado de primaria, es casada pero ya no vive con su esposo, tiene 7 hijos, 2  hombres y 5 mujeres.
texts.en:
This is a photo of the 'Concepción de Santiago' group which is located in Santiago Miahuatlan community, in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has 9 members.  This photo shows the business activity of Mrs Maria Del Rosario H. A. which is buying and selling the following products: small bags made from recyclable material, napkin rings, napkins, baskets and childhood memory items such as little boxes and picture frames which are made of wood.

Maria has been in this business for one year.  She makes her sales as a peddler in markets, parks or public places.  She says that she is already well known by many people who buy her products and they are satisfied because they say that the things she sells are very pretty, she sells them at a good price and they like the variety of products which she offers.

Maria is a new member of the group and she says that this is the first time that she has acquired a loan of this type.  Today she is happy and grateful for the trust that has been placed in her.  She says that she will use this loan to buy more merchandise and she will invest her profits in another business which she has in mind, selling quilts and bedspreads for this season.  Maria fully intends to grow her business and make good profits and also to finish building her house which, for one reason or another, she hasn't yet managed.  She is sure that with the help of the loans she will achieve this goal in the future.  Maria is 52 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is married but no longer lives with her husband.  She has 7 children: 2 grown-up sons and 5 grown-up daughters.

loans.use: To buy more handicrafts and recyclable materials

loans.name: Brigida Del Jesus

texts.es:
Brigida de 39 años, vende ropa en un mercado y es madre soltera de dos niños de 16 y 4 años. Vive con ellos en una casa de ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Empezó hace 9 años atrás a vender ropa cuando se inauguro el Mercado Municipal y le dieron un puesto para que venda la ropa. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días vendiendo pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, zapatillas a un valor muy económico. Ella sigue trabajando para poder mantener a sus dos hijos de 16 y 4 años ya que es madre soltera.     
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y sandalias para surtir su local de ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda para que sus hijos estén cómodos.
texts.en:
Brígida, 39, sells clothes in a market.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 16 and 4 years of age.  She lives with them in a house located along Guayaquil’s beltway, an area surrounded by an estuary.

She started selling clothes nine years ago when the Municipal Market opened and they gave her a stall to sell clothes.  She is currently open for business from 8am until 4pm every day selling pants, shirts, underwear and slippers at very accessible prices.  She continues to work to support her two children who are 16 and 4 years of age since she’s a single mother.

She will use the requested loan to buy to buy clothes and sandals to stock her store with clothes.  In the future she wants to enlarge the business and make improvements to her home so that her children can be more comfortable.

loans.use: For clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy Tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos.
