As she is an enterprising woman, she has many plans for the future.  Among them is the goal of opening a store to sell more calmly, as she would like to stop ambulatory sales in order to establish a more formal business.  This is the sixth loan that she has had with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually as she doesn't want to displease the people who make possible the money that will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Vicenta has planned to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a larger quantity of merchandise as she wants to have enough clothing for the summer season and as she has various orders pending, and in this way she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To supply Vicenta's business with enough items of clothing for the upcoming summer season

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Monsefú, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas, asimismo por la calidad de sus trabajos artesanales hechos de madera y junco. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet (Internet café), el cuenta con  un grupo de computadoras en un ambiente de su domicilio, allí brinda el servicio a los escolares de la zona los cuales siempre recurren a su establecimiento para buscar información de sus trabajos escolares y también para divertirse. 

Jorge desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de una impresora, de este modo el espera brindar un mejor servicio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Jorge es un joven bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Jorge, 27, is single and lives with his parents in Monsefú district, a district known regionally for its tourist and religious festivities as well as for the quality of the crafts made from wood and reeds.  The place is located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For two years he has provided Internet access services (Internet Café).  He has a group of computers set up in an area of his home where he provides local students with this service.  They always come by his place to seek information for their school projects and also to have fun.

Jorge wants to expand his business buying a printer so that he can provide better service.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to accomplish this.

Jorge is quite a responsible young man who very much wants to get ahead in life.  People who know him hold him in high regard and consider him to be a trustworthy person.

loans.use: To buy a printer to improve his Internet access service.

loans.name: Mili

texts.es: Mili, de 36 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Julio de 36 años, quien es taxista, y de su pequeña hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Esta carismática  mujer se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de dos marcas; y aunque tiene recién 8 meses en el negocio esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias son considerables. Además tiene clientes fijas que habitualmente le adquieren sus productos; es por esta razón que vende durante casi todo el día y no descansa  pues siempre esta en permanente contacto para continuar comercializando, pero no descuida la crianza de su hija. Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que hay algunos clientes que se atrasan en sus pagos y ella debe ir a cobrarles hasta sus casas y esto le hace perder tiempo. Como es una dama muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un puesto de venta de productos  de belleza pues quiere darle mayor impulso a este negocio. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mili tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, pues anhela almacenarlos para tenerlos en stock y venderlos a mayor precio.
texts.en: Mili, 36, lives in her own home with her husband Julio, 36, who is a taxi driver, and with their young daughter, together they word hard each day to get ahead. This charismatic woman sells two brands of beauty products; and although she has only spent the last 8 months in this business she is very satisfied as the profits are considerable. In addition she has customers who regularly buy her products; this is why she sells almost all day long and doesn't take a break so that she is always available to continue doing business, but she does not neglect the upbringing of her daughter. What she doesn't like about her work is that there are some customers who fall behind in their payments and she has to go to their homes to recover it and this costs her time. As she is a very entrepreneurial woman, she has future plans to install a kiosk to sell her beauty products as she wants to give this business a great boost. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her payments as she doesn't want to lose face with the people who make this investment possible which will allow her to keep working and progressing. Mili plans to invest the requested loan purchasing a greater quantity of beauty products, as she longs to keep them in stock and sell them at a greater price.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products.

loans.name: Melissa Jacqueline

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola conformada por varios caseríos considerados como zonas rurales. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales desde hace dos años. Ella cuenta con un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio en donde cría animales menores, los suele comercializar con los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente posee una pequeña bodega en su vivienda donde ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.

Melissa desea ampliar su negocio de crianza de animales adquiriendo mas ejemplares y alimento balanceado, asimismo desea adquirir mas productos para su bodega, con esta inversión espera aumentar su nivel de ingresos y ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y hogareña.
texts.en:
Melissa is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and son in Mórrope district, an agricultural area which is made up of a number of villages which are considered rural areas.  It is in Lambayeque province, forty-five minutes from Chiclayo.

Melissa raises and sells animals.  She has been doing this for two years.  She has a pen behind her house where she raises young animals.  She usually sells them to traders who visit her area.  She also owns a small grocery store in her home where she offers her neighbors a number of basic household products and groceries.

Melissa would like to expand her animal raising business by acquiring more animals and balanced feed.  She would also like to acquire more products for her grocery store.  With this investment she would like to increase her income and help her husband to get the family ahead in life.  She is quite a responsible and home-loving woman.

loans.use: To buy young animals and balanced feed.  To expand her business raising and selling animals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rony Albert

texts.es:
Rony tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el centro del distrito de Mórrope, una zona en donde se concentra bastante comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, el compra diversos animales menores en los diversos caseríos que se encuentran cerca de la zona en donde reside, los engorda y luego los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona y al público en general, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Rony desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales, asimismo desea arreglar sus corrales, para realizar estas acciones ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rony es un joven bastante trabajador y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran un muchacho responsable.
texts.en:
Rony, 22, is single and lives with his parents in the center of Mórrope district, a district where quite a bit of commerce is concentrated.  It belongs to Lambayeque province and is forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises small farm animals to sell.  He buys various animals in the areas surrounding his home, fattens them up and then sells them to merchants that frequent the area always as well as to the general public.  Income he earns he uses to cover his personal expenses and to help his parents support the family.

Rony wants to expand his business buying more animals.  He also wants to repair the animal pens.  To do this he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Rony is quite a hard working young man who very much wants to get ahead in life.  People who know him hold him in high regard and consider him to be a responsible young man.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and repair pens to expand his animal raising and sales business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, D. 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado D. su esposa Teresa D. 56 años y sus 5 hijos que son mayores y además ellos viven con sus respectivas familias; juntos se esfuerzan a diario por salir adelante. Este emprendedor hombre se desempeña como chofer D. una movilidad D. transporte público desD. hace 30 años, además ha trabajado como cobrador y, dice que le entretiene mucho su labor ya que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles educación. Durante todos estos años trabajó en diferentes empresas y en L. actualidad esta en el proceso D. alquiler y compra D. un vehiculo para lograr independizarse. Lo que no le gusta D. ser chofer es que muchas veces debe soportar el mal humor D. los pasajeros pues algunos son algo prepotentes, pero esta satisfecho pues trabaja solo un turno, desD. las 8 D. L. mañana hasta las  5 D. L. tarD. y obtiene regulares ganancias. Y como es un hombre con mucha expectativa para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa ya que quiere continuar progresando. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar con sus planes D. salir adelante. Nelson tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en L. compra D. materiales para refaccionar el piso D. su casa ya que quiere empezar con su anhelo que es instalar un negocio en ese lugar.
texts.en:
Nelson is 55 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife Teresa who is 56 years old and his 5  grown-up children who also live with their respective families.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.  This enterprising man has worked as a public transport driver for the past 30 years.  He has also worked as a conductor and he says that he likes his work a lot because it has allowed him to get his children ahead in life and give them an education.

Over the years, Nelson has worked for a number of different companies and he is currently in the process of renting and buying a vehicle so that he can become self employed.  What he doesn't like about being a driver is that many times he has to put up with his passengers' bad tempers since some of them are very overbearing.  However he is satisfied because he works only one shift from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon and he makes regular profits.

As Nelson is a man who has many hopes for the future, he is planning to set up a grocery store in his home as he would like to continue making progress.

This is the first loan which Nelson has had from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner because he doesn't want to let down the people who are providing this support which will allow him to continue with his plans to get ahead.  Nelson plans to invest his loan in buying materials to refurbish his house since he would like to begin work on his wish to set up a business there.

loans.use: To refurbish his house so that he can create a sales establishment there

loans.name: Carlos Valentín

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío Imperial del distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, el cría aves de corral y ovejas en corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre se encuentran recorriendo la zona donde reside, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a sus padres con el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Carlos desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

El es un joven muy responsable y que siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante su negocio, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Carlos is 25-years-old, single, and lives together with his parents in the village of Imperial in the Olmos district, a rural area that is part of the Lambayeque province and this is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He works raising and selling young animals.  He raises poultry and sheep in corrals located close to his house.  When these reach a good size he offers them for sale to buyers who are always passing through the area where he lives.  With the income he receives from these activities, he pays his personal expenses and supports his parents with the maintenance of the family expenses.

Carlos would like to expand his business by buying more animals so that he can increase his sales and see increased profits.  This is why he has found it convenient to request a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will allow him to achieve his goal.

He is a very responsible young man who is always looking for ways to move his business forward and his biggest hope is to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of animals to expand business raising and selling them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of needed products and groceries to expand small store in home.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: Richard, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su madre, y trabaja para brindarle una buena calidad de vida a ella y a sus hijos menores que no viven con él ya que es separado. Cada día es de constante esfuerzo y dedicación para Richard, pues empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano. Él brinda el servicio de taxi en su auto que es propio, además manifiesta con mucho orgullo que le agrada mucho su labor pues ya tiene pasajeros fijos que lo llaman cuando requieren de sus servicios. El tiempo le ha permitido conocer que pasajeros debe movilizar o cuales son los horarios adecuados para obtener mayores ganancias, pero lo que le disgusta  es que muchas veces debe trabajar durante varias horas en busca de pasajeros. Y como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para el futuro ya  tiene planeado instalar un negocio de venta de repuestos para autos y de esta manera desea continuar progresando. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar con su trabajo sin problemas. Richard tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en mandar su auto al taller para que le brinden mantenimiento, además quiere empezar a juntar para su futuro negocio.
texts.en: Richard is 42-years-old and lives in his own house alongside his mother and works to give her a better quality of life and also for his younger children who don’t live with him as he is separated from their mother.  Each day requires constant effort and dedication from Richard.  He begins work very early.  He offers taxi service in his own car and also proudly tells us that he likes his work a lot and now has regular passengers that call him when they require his services.  With time he has gotten to know when passengers need to go somewhere and what is the best schedule to obtain the best profits, but what he does not like is that often he has to work for several hours looking for passengers.  As he is an enterprising man, he plans to open a business selling car parts in the future and in this way he would like to continue moving forward.  This is his third loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually as he does not want to look bad to the people who have made this contribution possible so that he can continue working without problems.  Richard plans to invest the loan he is requesting in sending his car to a workshop so that they can do maintenance on it.  He also would like to begin to save for his future business.

loans.use: For technical maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el Caserío San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y golosinas en una bodega que tiene instalada en un ambiente de su vivienda. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela estable que prefiere comprar en su bodega debido al buen trato y a la calidad de productos que brinda. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cultivar limón y mango, con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades el se encarga solventar los gastos de la economía familiar.

Santos desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir creciendo como empresario, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder sacar adelante a su familia. El es una persona tranquila y bastante responsable. Las personas que le conocen le tienen muchas estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Santos is a father, he is 53-years-old, and lives together with his wife and children in the village of San Martín in the Tambogrande district, a rural area that works primarily in agriculture, that is part of the Piura region and is located a little over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He works in the sale of basic necessities, groceries, and sweets in a store that is located in his home.  Currently he has a stable clientele that prefer to buy from his store because of the good treatment he gives them and the quality of the products that he offers.  Additionally, he works growing limes and mangos.  With the income that these activities bring in, he provides for the family’s expenses.

Santos would like to expand his store with the purchase of more merchandise so that he can satisfy the demand from his customers and continue growing as a business owner.  This is why he has found it convenient to request a loan for 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

His biggest goal is to continue growing as a business owner so that he can help his family get ahead.  He is a calm and responsible person.  The people that know him have great esteem and respect for him.

loans.use: Purchase of basic necessities and groceries to expand store.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es: Willy, de 44 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su hija de 20 años y juntos se esfuerzan todos los días por salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años este trabajador hombre se dedica a fabricar tornos (pequeñas piezas para autos), y realiza esta  labor en la tranquilidad de su hogar, ya que trabaja durante todo el día, y él mismo determina su horario. Manifiesta orgulloso que esta muy contento con su  desempeño pues con el tiempo ha logrado comprar las mejores máquinas especiales para fabricar tornos lo que le facilita el buen desempeño de su trabajo en menos tiempo que antes. Aunque trabaja solo, no le falta clientes que requieren de sus piezas de metal ya que  cerca de su taller esta instalada una mecánica, pero lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces debe salir en busca de materiales y deja solo el taller lo que le hace perder clientes. Además obtiene  regulares ganancias con su negocio lo que le permite vivir cómodamente y ofrecerle una buena calidad de vida a su hija. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro quiere implementar mejor su negocio para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Willy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para fabricar tornos y cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente y espera entregarlo para mejorar sus ingresos y salir adelante.
texts.en: Willy is 44-years-old and lives in his own home along with his 20-year-old daughter and together they work every day to get ahead.  For the last ten years this hard-working man has worked making small brake parts for cars in the peace of his own home.  He works all day long and is able to set his own schedule.  He is proud to say that he is very happy with his work as with time he has been able to buy the best specialty machines for making these brake parts which allows him to do good work in less time than before.  Although he works alone, he doesn’t lack customers that require these metal parts as near his workshop there is a mechanic.  What he does not like is that often he must go out looking for materials and leave the taller alone so that he loses customers.  Additionally, the regular income from his business allows him to live comfortably and offer a better quality of life to his daughter.  As he is an enterprising man, in the future he would like to improve his business to offer improvements to his customers.  This is the first loan that he has requested with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually so as to not look bad to the people who made this contribution possible so that he can continue to work and look for ways to make progress.  Willy plans to invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of materials to make these brake parts and to complete an outstanding order that he hopes to complete to improve his income and get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make small car parts.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda S. is from the village of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Merlinda owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie D. is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Girlie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Girlie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 31 años, vive al lado de su esposo José de 34 años que es taxista y sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Esta afanosa mujer trabaja en las mañanas en la atención de un baño publico de su zona, solo trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, y esta muy satisfecha pues recibe un sueldo generoso por esta simple labor. Y cuando llegan las cinco  de la tarde saca su carrito salchipapero (especial para freír papas y salchichas)  afuera de su casa. En ese lugar vende deliciosas y baratas salchipapas (platillo compuesto de papas y hot dog fritos acompañadas  de cremas) y hamburguesas a los escolares que salen de clases en las tardes. Esta muy contenta con esta labor pues en poco tiempo obtiene también regulares ganancias y dice que le gusta mucho atender a los hambrientos niños que salen de sus clases. Además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante y continuar progresando. Es el sexto  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes en cantidad (papas, hot dogs y huevos)  que necesita para abastecer mejor su negocio, de esta manera espera incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: María is 31 years old.  She lives with her 34 year old husband José, who is a taxi driver, and with their two small children.  Together, they work to get ahead in life.  She is a solicitous woman; she works in the mornings to care for the public bathroom in her neighborhood.  She only does this work from 8am until 1pm, and she is very happy to receive a generous salary for this simple work.  And when 5pm arrives, she takes her little salchipapero cart (specially made to fry potatoes and sausages) outside of her home.  From this cart she sells delicious and cheap salchipapas (a plate made up of potatoes and fried hotdogs accompanied with creams) and hamburgers to the students who leave classes in the afternoons.  She is very happy with this work as in a little bit of time she has regular earnings and says that she really likes serving the hungry kids who are leaving classes.  Also, as a hardworking woman, for the future she plans to have a restaurant and to continue moving ahead.  This is the 6th loan that she has taken with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually as she doesn't want to displease the people who make possible the support that will permit her to continue working towards progress.    María plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of ingredients in quantity (potatoes, hot dogs, and eggs) that she needs to better supply her business, in this manner she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To supply non-perishable foods to use in María's business

loans.name: Nadija

texts.en:
Nadija S. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Nadija owns and operates a boarding house in the local community. Nadija has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nadija joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nadija is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to expand her services. This will be the first loan taken out by Nadija from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand her services

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena P. is from the city of P-7 Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old and is married. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling used clothes in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert, de 42 años, vive en la casa de su madre en compañía de ella y de sus dos hijas mayores, que trabajan y estudian. Juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde muy joven este emprendedor hombre aprendió a tocar diversos instrumentos musicales como la zampoña y el charango (instrumentos peruanos). Por la falta de empleo decidió buscar un oficio antes las diversas necesidades que pasaba su madre; es así que en la actualidad comparte su música en los vehículos de transporte público de la ciudad. Además vende golosinas luego que acaba el repertorio musical, de esta manera obtiene mejores ganancias. Le gusta mucho su labor pues se entretiene bastante y pasea durante todo el día; sin embargo le disgusta que muchas veces los chóferes de los vehículos no paran para recogerlo pues lo consideran una perdida de tiempo; pero aún así continua con las ganas de siempre por progresar. Además como siempre piensa en el futuro ya tiene planeado instalar una juguería en su casa, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá salir adelante  en sus negocios. Robert tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunos implementos (licuadora, extractor, menaje, vasos y platos)  que le hacen falta para instalar de una vez su juguería.
texts.en:
Robert, age 42, lives at his mother’s house with her and his two grown daughters who are working and studying. Together they strive each day to get ahead. At a young age, this enterprising man learned to play various musical instruments such as the “zampoña” and the “charango” (Peruvian instruments). Due to the lack of employment, he decided to look for a job so that he could help meet his mother’s needs. Now he performs music on public transportation vehicles that travel throughout the city. Robert also sells candy after he performs his musical repertoire in order to earn more income. He enjoys his work because it is entertaining and it allows him pass through the day. However, he does not like the vehicle drivers who refuse to let him board because they consider his music to be a waste of time, yet he continues to press forward since he always desires to make progress. Robert is always thinking about the future and plans to open a juice bar at his house so that he can earn more income.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He promises to submit his payments on time because he does not want to look bad to those who made this loan possible so that he can succeed with his businesses. Robert plans to invest the loan he requested in the purchase of equipment (a blender, a juicer, utensils, glasses, and plates) that he needs to open his juice bar.

loans.use: Purchase a blender, a juicer, utensils, glasses, and plates in order to open a juice bar

loans.name: Ravelyn

texts.en:
Ravelyn C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 24 years old, married and has a 4-year-old child. Ravelyn owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Ravelyn also helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Ravelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ravelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets, feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa A. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Generosa owns and operates a transportation business. Generosa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Generosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Generosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Generosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto A. is from the town of Surallah. He is 41 years old, married and has 2 children aged 16 and 8. Roberto owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roberto works hard to keep up with the increasing needs in his household.

Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roberto has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his family's house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 65 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Adriana owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adriana wants to extend help to her children even if they already have their own families. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school.

Adriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adriana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Ms. Maricon N. is from Barangay IV, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and single. Maricon is presently engaged in operating a carenderia (mini-restaurant) and Internet café. She also receives support from her parents who work abroad. Maricon has been engaged in this business for 3 years and earns a monthly average of at least 3,500 PHP from it.

Just this year, Maricon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricon, as a newly-recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as her 1st loan. She plans to use the loan for additional capital to extend her café and for her existing carenderia. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Internet cafe extension and additional capital for her carenderia business

loans.name: Deberlane

texts.en:
Mrs. Deberlane P. is from the barangay (suburb) of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married to Rancito P. and blessed with 3 children, 2 school-aged and one infant. Deberlane is presently engaged in operating an eatery business. She also receives support from her husband, a jabal-jabal driver, who earns 100 PHP per day. Deberlane has been engaged in her business for 3 months and, although she’s new to it, is earning a monthly income of at least 2,500 PHP. 

Just this year, Deberlane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly-recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Deberlane is requesting her first loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her existing eatery business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments, the children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her existing eatery business

location.town: Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Sialupe Baca, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral y ganado caprino en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en donde reside. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda percibir mas ganancias por su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y bastante responsable, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, por ello se esfuerza dia a dia para sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the village of Sialupe Baca, a rural area that is part of Lambayeque District and located more than twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals, specifically poultry and goats that she keeps behind her house. When the animals have reached the appropriate level of development, Rosa offers them for sale to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. This business enables her to help her husband with the family expenses.

Rosa wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed so that she can generate more revenue from her business. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help her meet this objective.

Rosa is a peaceful and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to provide her family a better quality of life, so she strives day after day to get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase animals & animal feed

loans.name: Arlito

texts.en:
Mr. Arlito C. is from the barangay (suburb) of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old, married to Andressa C. and blessed with 1 child. Arlito is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store as well as a rice retailing business. He has been operating these businesses for 6 years and earns an monthly average of at least 3,500 PHP from them. 

In 2009, Arlito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Arlito has successfully repaid a loan of 40,000 PHP. He is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as his 4th loan, which will be used as additional capital for his existing businesses. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve his family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments, his child’s education and possible business expansions.


 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old. Bella is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding.  Bella also helps her husband at the farm. They have a rice field that her husband manages. Their harvest is used for selling and family consumption.

Bella joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Bella is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
68-year-old Dionita is a married woman from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has seven children. Most of her children have their own families already. Dionita has grandchildren already and she hopes to be able to extend help to them also.

Dionita earns a living by raising pigs for fattening. She sells pork meat to the market. She also helps her husband maintain their farm. She helps keep their rice crops healthy. 

Dionita needs feeds for the pigs and farm supplies for their rice farm. She is requesting a loan of Php 20, 000 that she will use to continue running her piggery and farm.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 8 children. Her children are mostly married and have their own families already. 

Fe raises pigs for a living. She says this kind of business is quite challenging but she is happy to have a source of income. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him maintain their rice farm.

Fe is in need of feeds and vitamins for her pigs to grow healthy. She also needs additional rice seeds and fertilizers for their rice farm. She applied for a loan of Php 18000 that she will use to run her piggery and her husband's farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and additional rice seeds

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Federico also grows pigs for fattening and sale. His wife helps him sell pork meat to the market.

loans.name: Edwina Rosauro's Group

Edwina is from the village of Pob.1 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Edwina is the group leader of this group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edwina R.'s Group.

Edwina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Edwina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food in the local community. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edwina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase ingredients needed to make product for sale. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Edwina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en:
Ma. Bella P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old. Ma. Bella is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is aged 19 while the youngest is 7. Her children all go to school and it is a challenge for Ma. Bella and her husband to sustain their education. She says it is hard to keep up with the increasing tuition fees every year.

Ma. Bella raises pigs for fattening. She sells pork meat to the market. She also helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. Ma. Bella hopes for her and her husband's businesses to grow and be able to support their family.

Ma. Bella is planning to buy additional piglets to raise. She applied for a loan of Php 10000 that she will use to purchase piglets, feeds, and farm fertilizers. She is hopeful that this loan will be of great help to her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feeds, and farm fertilizers

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlinda also grows pigs and ducks. She hopes to acquire more ducks and piglets to raise. 

Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Donna

Donna G. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 27 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Donna wants to improve her business and earn a better income for her family.

Donna joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 22 years old and married. She has 1 child, aged 1 year and 4 months. She is a farmer, just like her husband. They both cultivate their land for planting and harvesting rice crops. Farrah hopes to increase their harvest and earn more. She plans to save for her child's education in the near future.

Farrah needs additional farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), a KIVA partner. She will use the loan to fund her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming inputs

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia J. is a widow who lives in Purok 4, Brgy. Masaling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental, in the Philippines. She earns a living through 3 business ventures: operating a general store, buying and selling rice, and fattening pigs.

Amalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of 12 prior loans from Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living.  This time, for her thirteenth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy inventory for the general store and feed for the pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business ventures.

Amalia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF's alleviation program empowers women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. The women are taking a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"--a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and joining the team.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and pig feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane O. is 37 years old, is married, and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a ready-to-wear business and and a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in the Philippines in Railings, Brgy. Poog, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready-to-wear and sari-sari businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Mary Jane has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to fund her operations. This will be her eleventh loan from Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was another step on her journey to economic freedom.

Mary Jane aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old and resides in Teresa, which is located in the province of Rizal. She lives with her husband and their four children.

Helen has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and various products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan to buy more food products and basic household goods. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Helen’s business is very important because it enables her to provide more financial stability for her family so they can live decently. She hopes to provide her family with everything necessary to move forward, out of poverty.  

Helen dreams of the best for her family: expanding her business, having a happy family, and providing a better education for her four children so they can find better employment. She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded enough to make her dreams come true. She hopes that the productivity of her business will continue to increase and improve the overall quality of her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food products and other inventory

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
I Putu S. is a 34-year-old male living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  I Putu is the new group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by MUK. He was chosen to replace I Ketut Budi Utama who went work to in Denpasar.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Taman Indah (PK-10372).


I Putu is married and has one adult and one school-aged child.  To make a living, I Putu owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  I Putu has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 750,000 IDR a month from this activity.


In 2010, I Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  I Putu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,375,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  He is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by I Putu from MUK.  I Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





I Putu S. (0) merupakan 34 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  I Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 8 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Taman Indah (PK-10372).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  I Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Putu menghasilkan sekitar 500.000 - 750.000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, I Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I Putu telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.375.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.400.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is married with a 12-year-old son.  As a busy entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for almost three years.  Building her business, she would like to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her store.  She is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other related supplies.  Ma. Luisa believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in the community.

A dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Ma. Luisa has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long-term goals are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her son’s education.  Through hard work and determination, Ma. Luisa is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other related items for her store.

loans.name: Budi

texts.en:
Budi S. (PK-00251) is a 42-year-old male living in the town of Pejarakan - Singaraja, Indonesia.  He is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Budi owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Budi has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Budi joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Budi is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. Budi is now requesting a new loan of 2,500,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Budi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


  


Budi S. (PK-00251) merupakan 42 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Pejarakan - Singaraja - Bali.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Budi memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan ringan & makanan kecil lainnya di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Budi sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Budi menghasilkan sekitar 500.000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2010, Budi bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Budi telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2.500.000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris & modal kerja tambahan.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.  Budi berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking..  "

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 32-year-old creative man with three children living in a mud wattle house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of building a permanent house in the next five years for his family. He has been in service as a driver for 10 years after working as a hawker for three years. His business dream is to have enough land for cultivation. George intends to use the loan to buy land for expanding his plantation from which the family earns a living.

loans.use: To buy land to expand his plantation

loans.name: Mairamkul Kazakbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul K. is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married. In order to earn money her husband works in construction. Together they are raising a daughter and a son. Their daughter works as a nurse, and their son is at school.

Mairmakul is a nurse, too, but she is also engaged in cattle breeding. She started doing so five years ago with an initial investment of 15000 KGS. Reselling cattle after fattening them brings Mairamkul 5000 KGS a month. She applied for this loan because she needs the money to purchase two bulls for breeding.

In the near future Mairamkul plans to start building a new cattle shed.

About Mol Bulak :

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls for breeding

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
With perseverance, one is sure to achieve success. This seems to be the mindset of 54-year-old community partner Ma. Luisa T. of Caloocan City, Philippines. Luisa reached college and is married to Dante, who works as a printer. They have three children: one in college, another in high school, and the youngest in elementary school.

Luisa is a persevering entrepreneur, juggling three small-scale businesses at one time. She buys and sells laptops; she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells school supplies; and she manages a burger, siomai, and mami stand. All of these products Luisa offers to her neighbors and to everyone in the community who find these products worth their money. Given these three businesses, Luisa earns around 10,000 PHP monthly.

To continue her business operations, Luisa applied for a 36,000 PHP loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional stock for her variety store and food stand businesses. She believes that through her perseverance and being a faithful steward, God will bless her businesses and establish them successfully. Luisa dreams that with her businesses going strong and gaining, her children will be able to finish their college education and get stable jobs someday.

Luisa faithfully attends her weekly fellowship meetings together with her co-members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To replenish stocks for her businesses

texts.en:
Hurtoji Z. is a resident of Aravan. She is the leader of this group. Hurtoji is a 67-year old widow. She has raised three sons and all of them are working in Russia. In order to make money, Hurtoji has been breeding cattle for 30 years. Reselling some cattle after fattening, she makes 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding.  In the future, she wants to increase the number of cattle, provide her grandchild a good education and be able to support him financially.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Susana is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Susana owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies, especially cinnamon bread, in the local community. Susana is just starting this business because she finds that she is earning more in this cinnamon business than in a retail store.

In 2010, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Susana is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Francisca needs additional piglets, feed and farm supplies. She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP which she will use for the pigs and farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a resident of a historic city of Lahore in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area named Shalimar. She moved there 20 years ago. Razia is a widow with a son and a daughter. Her son does embroidery and she supports him in her spare time by doing embroidery work. Her daughter is eighteen years old and studies in the 10th grade. Razia herself operates a glass selling business. She sells glass to different glass shops on order. The glass is used to make windows and tables. She has been in this business for the past five years. Her earnings allows her to pay for the utilities expenses of her family.  

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her glass selling business. With the loan, she will buy glass to fulfill the orders of her clients and increase the profits. Razia is hopeful that an increased profit will help her to collect dowry for her daughter's marriage and she will be able to marry her after she completes her education.  

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself  a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Razia.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in Lahore which is a big city in Punjab province in Pakistan known for its history and culture . She lives there in the area named Shalimar with her family in a 2 room brick house. 
She is divorced and does embroidery to earn a living for herself. Robina didn’t want to become a burden on her brother and that’s why she started embroidering clothes by receiving orders from her neighboring clients. She doesn’t have any children. 
Robina's brother is involved in a business of selling toys. He sells different kinds of toys such as plastic and rubber toys to his customers. This is his main business which helps him to earn income for the family. 

Robina is very supportive lady in nature and always looking to help her family. That's why she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother. He will invest the loan in purchasing toys in bulk . This will help him to fulfill the demands of his customers on time and in increasing the sales as well.  He has had this business for over 10 years and Robina is very confident that a loan investment will bring more profits for her brother and she will gain more respect in the family in a result. 
Robina is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has maintained  good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 
Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Robina.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 52 years old. Jessie is married and has 3 children aged 21, 19 and 17. Jessie is a farmer and he has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years. His wife helps him maintain their rice farm and sell their harvest to the market. Over a year ago, Jessie invested in an ice cream business. He bought his own ice cream cart and started selling around their neighborhood when he is free of farming duties. He found it enjoyable but realized he needs to hire an ice cream boy to do it for him so that he could focus on his farm.

Jessie is now requesting to loan Php16000 from CEVI, a KIVA partner. He will use the loan to purchase farm supplies and an additional ice cream tub. Jessie is hopeful that this loan will help him pursue his plans in his business.
