texts.en:
Suraiya I. A. is 34 years old and married to I. A. who is 35 years old. They have two sons and a daughter, all of whom are enrolled in local schools and getting an education. Suraiya lives in Lahore which is the second largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area known as Shalimar. She moved there after her marriage.

Suraiya helps support her family through sewing jobs. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood and receives regular orders from them every month. I. A. has a business selling construction supplies to different construction companies. He has been in this business for over ten years and is well experienced in his field.

Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah to help her husband improve his construction supplies business. With the loan he will buy construction supplies in larger quantities so he will be able to serve more clients and increase his income.

Suraiya, too, is hopeful that a loan will help her husband improve his business and increase his profits. She is a regular loan client of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan periods she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Rizaldy

texts.en:
Rizaldy M. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. He is 41 years old. Rizaldy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizaldy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cycle taxi or habal-habal services to local community members. Rizaldy and his wife are also engaging in buying and selling variety of fish like mackerel, sardines & milk fish. Rizaldy has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rizaldy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizaldy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sale. Rizaldy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorela. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rizaldy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of his motorela

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Myrna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, eggs, detergents & canned goods in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory for sale & working capital. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Aminahon's Group

texts.en:
Aminahon A. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Aravan. Aminah is 51 years old and married. Her husband is retired and he receives a monthly pension in amount of 3000 soms. In order to make money to cover family expenses Aminahon and her husband breed cattle. They have been doing it for 19 years. They started with the initial investment of 10000 soms and now, selling some cattle after fattening, they make 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Aminahon wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle, start building a new fence and repair the kitchen in the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 36 years old. Marilou is single and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 13. Her 4 children all go to school. Marilou said that it has been a challenge for her and her husband to sustain their children's education because tuition fees increase every year.

Marilou helps provide her family's needs through farming. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest to the market. She works hard to increase her harvest with every crop to earn more income. Marilou wishes to have a stable income that could sustain her family.

Marilou is requesting for a loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other the farm supplies that she needs. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ernesto Lhofane

texts.pt:
Ernesto Lhofane C., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, vive maritalmente na sua própria casa, pai de 2 filhas de 4 e 10 anos ambos vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Sustenta seus pais e irmãos que vive com ele.

Nunca saiu do Distrito inicia seu negócio de criação de poedeiras com um fundo que obteve na altura do mukero(produtos contrabandiado), tem criado em média 45 poedeiras tendo diariamente 45 ovos vendendo cada a 5.00mt a razão de 225.00mt diarios. Tem de lucro 6.750.00mt mensal que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria. Devido a aderência ele aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo para aumentar o numero das poedeiras, porque devido a alimentação das mesmas o valor não tem sido notório e pretende também fornecer ovos a instituições e mercearias a grosso.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende aumentar o numero das suas poedeiras. Os anteriores empréstimos no valor de (25.000.00 e 40.000.00mt) foram usados para criação de pintos.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais empréstimo para ampliação das capoeiras.
texts.en:
Ernesto Lhofane C. was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. He is married and lives with his family, and has 2 daughters who are 4 and 10 years old. They both attend school. Ernesto only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue due to financial difficulties. He helps support his parents and siblings  who live with him.

Ernesto continues to live in Namaacha and started a business raising hens to lay eggs, using funds that he obtained working in mukero (selling contraband goods). He keeps around 45 hens, producing 45 eggs per day and selling them for 5 Meticais each. He makes around 225 Meticais per day. His monthly earnings come to 6750 Meticais, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some money each month in his bank account. Because of his dedication, he approached Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner] to ask for a loan to buy more hens. Because of the cost of feed his profits have been small, but he would like to start providing eggs wholesale to institutions and grocery stores 

This is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 10,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy more laying hens. His earlier loans were for 25,000 and 40,000 Meticais and were used to buy and raise chicks.

Ernesto is confident that he will be able to repay the loan ahead of schedule and then request another loan to expand his chicken coops.

loans.use: Purchase of laying hens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Claudia Karina

texts.es: Claudia Karina P. D. de 25 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente, junto a su esposo y una hija menor de edad. Claudia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Claudia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. Claudia es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Claudia Karina P. D. is 25 years old.  She lives in San Vicente department with her husband and her school-age daughter.  Claudia has a store in which she sells basic household goods such as bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, vegetables and other products besides.  She is a very responsible and kind person who has a number of customers even though her store doesn't have a great variety of products.

Claudia is requesting a loan so that she has enough money to buy a larger quantity of products since her biggest wish is to be able to stock her business and thereby make more profits.  Claudia is a very responsible mother who would like to be able to provide her daughter with the best.

loans.use: To buy basic household products to stock her store

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Luzminda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, junk foods,  beverages & instant noodles in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Daniel Eduardo

texts.es: Daniel Eduardo A. G. de 26 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable y trabajador, quien reside en el departamento de San Vicente, junto a su esposa y dos hijos de: 8 y 1 año de edad. Daniel trabaja arduamente vendiendo: sabanas, edredones, cortinas, hamacas y otros artículos más para el hogar, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por diferentes pueblos, así mismo su esposa le ayuda a vender desde su casa de habitación. Daniel solicita un préstamo, con el enorme deseo de poder invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que sus ventas puedan incrementarse en gran manera. De esta forma Daniel espera mejorar su economía familiar y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Daniel Eduardo A. G. is 26 years of age and is a very responsible and hardworking person. He lives in the department of San Vincente with his wife and two children who are 1 and 8 years of age. Daniel works extremely hard as a street vendor, selling sheets, eiderdowns, curtains, hammocks, and other articles for the home. He sells these articles in different villages, while his wife helps him sell the same items from their home.

Daniel has a great desire to invest in his business, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase a large quantity of products so as to increase his sales accordingly. In this way Daniel hopes to improve the economic situation of his family. He also hopes to have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase curtains, sheets and other articles to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 41-years-old, married with five children, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband. She and her husband have been engaged in the vegetables and fruit vending business for almost a year to support the family. 
 
To supply additional income for her family, Celia would like to receive a new loan of 10,000PHP to expand the family’s business.  With the loan, she will purchase supplies of vegetables and fruits to sell.  With additional stocks, Celia believes the increased inventory will generating higher income and profits for the business. 

A dedicated member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Celia is grateful for access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  Celia has achieved strong performance with regular attendance to group meetings and steady repayments on her previous loans. 

Her long term goals are to purchase a jeepney or tricycle so that she can expand her vegetables & fruits vending business to other surrounding neighborhoods. By owning her own transportation, Celia will save time and money in purchasing a greater variety of inventory as well as selling products in additional territories. 

With her hard work, focus, and determination, Celia is hopeful that her business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: will purchase  supplies of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian C. de 39 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hija mayor de edad, un nieto y su yerno, Marta se dedica a la elaboración de quesadillas, un pan tradicional el cual posee muy buena demanda. Desde hace 10 años que trabaja de esta manera para ganarse la vida, por lo que posee muchos clientes, a los cuales les reparte las quesadillas a domicilio. Marta es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que es esta su única fuente de ingresos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima como: queso, harina, semillas de ajonjolí y otras más para elaborar más quesadillas y atender mayor cantidad de pedidos para esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Marta Lilian C. is 39 years of age and lives in Mejicanos,  which i  in the San Salvador department . She lives with her grown up daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. Over the last ten years Marta has earned a living making quesadillas, a traditional type of bread which is very popular.  Because she has worked in this business for so long, Marta has many customers, and she delivers the quesadillas to their door. 

Marta is a very responsible and hardworking person who has high hopes of improving her business as it is her only source of income. For this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase all of the necessary quesadilla ingredients including cheese, flour and sesame seeds, among others, so she can make more quesadillas and cater for a more orders for this Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make quesadillas

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester M. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old. Ester is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  vegetables like camote tops & other leafy vegetables. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ester is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Daniel Alberto

texts.pt:
Daniel Alberto B. nasceu na Provincia de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, solteiro, não tem filhos. Fez 10ª classe não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive numa casa alugada pagando mensalmente 800.00mt. responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ele em sua casa.

Saiu de Zambezia para o Distrito de Namaacha com seu tio alegando que ia estudar. Após sua chegada dá continuidade dos seus estudos e faz a  10ª classe, mas devido a morte do seu tio teve que interroper com os estudos,  consecutivamente  teve que iniciar o seu próprio negócio com o fundo da indimunização que obteve no serviço do falecido tio para sua sobrevivência. Hoje é proprietário de duas Bancas no Mercado Central que suporta uma mercadoria de aproximadamente 25.000,00mt graças aos empréstimos que teve na Hluvuku e Kiva.  Trabalha das 7h as 17h tem como melhor produto (faces e baterias de telefone, filmes e mais) gastando em média de 8.000mt na compra dos mesmos e tendo de lucro um valor de 2.500.00mt semanalmente que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria. Conta com ajuda do seu sobrinho pagando lhe mensalmente um valor de 1.000mt.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Daniel na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (baterias de celular, discos de filmes e musica e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto. Os anteriores de (5.000.00 e 10.000.00) foram para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir novo empréstimo para legalizar o seu próprio terreno.
texts.en:
Daniel Alberto B. was born in the province of Zambézia in central Mozambique. He is single and has no children. He only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue due to financial difficulties. He lives in a rental house and pays 800 Meticais a month in rent. He helps to support his nephew who lives with him. 

Daniel left Zambezia for the district of Namaacha with his uncle, thinking that he would go to school there. After arriving in Namaacha he did continue with his studies, and finished 10th grade, but his schooling was interrupted when his uncle died. He then started his own business with the money he received after his uncle's death, intended to help him get by on his own. Today Daniel is the owner of two kiosks in the Mercado Central [Central Market] with merchandise valued at approximately 25,000 Meticais, thanks to his loans with Hluvuku [the Kiva field partner].  He works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM, and his best selling products are telephone batteries and covers, and movies. He spends 8000 Meticais on average to purchase these items and makes a profit of 2500 Meticais per week. He uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some in his bank account. His nephew helps out by giving him around 1000 Meticais each month.

This is Daniel's 3rd loan, for the amount of 15,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy cell phone batteries, DVDs and CDs, and other items, in order to increase his range of products. His earlier loans, for 5000 and 10,000 Meticais, were used for the same purpose. 

Daniel is confident that he will be able to repay the loan ahead of schedule and take out a new loan to cover the legal fees needed for his land.

loans.use: Purchase of cell phone batteries, DVDs and CDs, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy whole nuts to obtain the inner nuts to sell

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Isabelita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Isabelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Isabelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to  buy and sell. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Isabelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima I. is the treasurer of this group. She is a 60 years old widow. Salima has raised three sons; all of them are working in Russia. In order to make money Salima breeds farm animals. She has eight sheep, a cow and a calf. Her grandchildren help her with that activity. Reselling some farm animals after fattening she makes 5000 soms per month. That profit makes it possible for her to receive treatment in the hospital.  With money received from the loan Salima wants to purchase a cow, in order to start selling dairy products. In the future Salima wants to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new chair and disk for his shop

loans.name: Mary Nanette

texts.en:
Mary Nanette E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old and has a 1-year-old child. Mary Nanette and her husband separated due to conflicts. She decided to be the one to take care of their baby.

Mary Nanette earns a living through raising pigs and fish vending. She raises pigs for fattening and sells pork at the market. She also buys fish from fishermen and goes around their neighborhood selling them. Mary Nanette works hard to be able to feed her baby and herself.

Mary Nanette needs a loan to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them. She also needs a weighing scale and a styrofoam box for selling fish. She requested for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, a partner of KIVA. Mary Nanette really needs this loan to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and fish-vending materials

loans.name: Celeste Alfredo

texts.pt:
Celeste Alfredo C. nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, na Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada mãe de 7 filhos, com idades comprieendidas entre os 19 aos 38 anos de idade, 4 deles já estão empregados e 3 vão a Escola. Vive na casa propria e responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa.

Celeste sai de Manhiça para Vila de Namaacha com seu esposo, este que foi transferido para trabalhar naquele Distrito, ela inicia com o negócio de venda refeições nas barracas da fronteira que depois foram abolidas pelo Governo do Distrito devido a poluição do ambiente. Com ajuda do seu vizinho que também era um grande criador ela constroi uma capoeira na sua residência e inicia com o mesmo negócio e tornou se numa grande criadora ate então, tem criado no maximo 100x5 caixas de pintos gastando 50.000.00mt e vende cada frango a 125.00mt, cria em fases para poder vender alternadamente. Tem vendido a maior parde dos frangos a grosso, pois gastam menos ração e tem tido um lucro de 12.500.00mt e por unidade para consumidores locais o lucro decresce para 10.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta Instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt para comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade de frangos para calhar com a época festiva que se aproxima. Os anteriores emprestimos de (10.000.00, 10.500.00 e 25.000.00) forão também usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para adquirir uma carrinha que lhe facilitara nos trabalhos diários.
texts.en:
Celeste Alfredo C. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is married and has 7 children ranging in age from 19 to 38 years old. Four of her children are working and 3 attend school. She lives in her own house and helps support her niece, who lives with her.

Celeste moved from Manhiça to the district of Namaacha with her husband, who was transferred there for work. She started a business selling meals in the barracks on the border with Swaziland; these were later closed by the government due to the pollution in the area. With the help of her neighbor, who did well raising poultry, she built a chicken coop by her house and started raising chickens. She has also become very successful with this venture. She's raised hundreds of chicks and has spent around 50,000 Meticais in doing so, while she can sell each chicken for 125 Meticais. She staggers the age of the chicks so that she always has mature chickens to sell. She sells most of her chickens wholesale, since she saves on feed that way, and she's made a profit of 12,500 Meticais. She also sells directly to local consumers, though her profit doing this is only 10,000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and also saves some in her bank account. 

Celeste has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 5th loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy chicks, feed and vitamins in order to increase the number of chickens she can raise, as she want more chickens to sell during the coming holidays. Her earlier loans were for 10,000, 10,500 and 25,000 Meticais and were used for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan ahead of schedule and take out new loan to buy a pushcart that will help her in her daily work.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia L. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Sari-sari (general) store and livestock businesses. She lives in Media Once, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP16,000. Rosalia is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she  can  purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

 Rosalia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty C. is from the village of Santiago, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Betty is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns & operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat at her house. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional pigs. Betty is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs for the business and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for the business and use as working capital

loans.name: Bintirashid

texts.en:
Bintirashid is a widow with five children; one still attend school while four have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over ten years, she has operated a cashew nut selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and passersby. Bintirashid faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the hot summer season, cashew nut supply is less compared to the rainy season where the supply is high. She hopes to expand and sell a larger quantity of cashew nuts in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
Menardo A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 30 years old. Menardo is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Menardo owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & vegetables like squash and eggplants in the local community. Menardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Menardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Menardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Menardo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Menardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is a widow  who lives in Brgy. Luray 2, Toledo City, Cebu . She earns her living by operating one business venture: buying and re-selling bananas.  She has 6 children who are 35 to 55 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her family's needs. 

Teresita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.name: Crispina Caaway Group

texts.en:
Crispina is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, She is 61 years old. Crispina is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Crispina C. Group.
Crispina is married and has two adult-aged children. Crispina owns and operates a business Agricultural Sector. The main source of income for the business comes from raising crops. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns an average of approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.
In March 31,2009 Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Crispina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for raising crops for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Crispina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Betuel Cardoso

texts.pt:
Betuel C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, tem 22 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 2 anos não vão a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras para pagar o seu internamento na Escola Secundária porque da escola para sua casa dista 30 km. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e irmã que vivem com ele.

Saiu da Matola para Namaacha quando o pai vendeu propriedade de terra na Matola. Então inicia sua actividade pesqueira e comercial. E proprietário de um barco a remo e um estabelecimento comercial que obteve atraves do rendimento nas suas actividades de venda de combustivel e com ajuda da Hluvuku e kiva. Tem como melhor marisco o (peixe) e conta com ajuda de dois empregados e consegue 10.000.00mt por mês dependendo mas da estação do tempo.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravas de amigos que são nossos clientes. Este é terceiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual ira comprar redes de pesca para aumentar o volume do stock e satisfazer a clientela. Os anteriores créditos de (10.000.00 e 5.000.00mt) forão para a mesma actividade.

Tem como objectivo dar inicio da sua obra e adquirir mas empréstimos para comprar mas um barco para reforçar seu negócio.
texts.en:
Betuel C. was born in the town of Matola, in the Maputo Province. He is 22 years old and is in a common law marriage. He has two children who are 2 and 4 years old and not in school. He went to school until 7th grade but didn't continue due to lack of financial resources to pay for boarding school for high school. The school was 30km away from his home. He lives in his own house and supports his mother and sister who live with him. 

He left Matola to go to Namaacha when his father sold his land. He then started his commercial and fishing business. He owns a row boat and a store. He was able to own them with his income from selling fuel and with Hluvuku and Kiva's help. His best product is fish. He has two employees to help him and makes 10,000 meticais per month, depending on the season.

He has never had loans with other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also our partners. This loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais, is his third. He will buy fishing nets to increase his inventory and please his clientele. The previous loans were for 10,000 and 5,000 meticais and were used in the same activity. 

His goal is to start working and to request more loans to purchase another boat to increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Rhynna

texts.en:
Rhynna A. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Rhynna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready to wear clothing and used clothing in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rhynna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional clothing products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 23 years old and married. She graduated from preparatory school. She will use this loan to develop her business and purchase another sewing machine, cloth and ribbons. The borrower’s high character and experience helped her to gain lot of clients. She is a skilled lady in sewing women's fashions in various styles. This loan will help her to raise her family’s income.

loans.use: For purchasing a sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa M. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 20 years old. Nelsa is currently pregnant with her first baby. She is not married yet but plans to settle down and have her own family. Nelsa's parents are both farmers and they gave her a parcel of land where rice crops are planted. Nelsa maintains it now and hopes to earn from it once harvest comes. She hopes to be able to sustain the farm and have a stable business. 

Nelsa still needs additional farm supplies like fertilizers. She applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP from CEVI. She said she likes the MFI's services and feels secure because of its micro-insurance program.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Batochir

texts.en:
Mr. Batochir D. is 47 years old, married and has two sons. His elder son, Gankhulug, 22, is married and works as a policeman at the railroad police department; he lives with his family in his own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Batochir’s younger son, Gankhuu, 19, is a student at the police academy and will be a policeman after he graduates. Batochir's wife looks after his grandson at home.

Batochir’s family is the most important thing to him. He says as a father he would like to be financially able to provide a good education for his children. His son Gankhulug's employer has given him a lease on an apartment; therefore, he is asking for a loan to pay 900,000 MNT for the first payment installment. He is short by this amount.

loans.use: For a loan to pay 900,000 MNT for a first installment on an apartment lease

texts.en:

To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, rice by the kilogram and medicines in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Merly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.name: Newmee

texts.en:
Newmee M. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 31 years old, married and has a one-year-old child. Newmee has been engaged in rice farming for almost twenty years already. She learned farming from her parents. When she got married, she and her husband invested in land that they are now cultivating for rice crops. She also raises hogs to have an extra source of income. She hopes to acquire more piglets to grow.

Newmee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Newmee is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

He is also buying and selling electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE & SMART. Jonas has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jonas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonas is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jonas from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 31 years old, married and has two children. The borrower graduated from intermediate school. He will use this loan to develop his business to redecorate and purchase new sorts of cloth. The borrower has a good reputation in the market, honest and true with his clients, and that makes him gain a lot of clients. The borrower sells his garments to the clients at reasonable prices and offers high quality cloth.

loans.use: For purchasing cloth

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She operates a retail store, selling rice, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fats and kerosene. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Margaret faces a challenge of competition from other retail shop operators and the high cost of transporting goods from the market to her place of business. She hopes to expand and sell as wholesale in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and 50 litres of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and 50 litres of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Rio Bulay Group

texts.en:
Rio B., from the village of Locsoon,Tudela, Misamis Occidental is the 30-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member should delinquency or default occur. The official name of this borrowing group is Rio B. Group.

Rio, who is married and has one school-aged child, owns and operates a business growing crops for sale. Rio has been in business for over four years, earning approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

On June 18, 2009, Rio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, Rio is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and green crops to grow. This loan will be her second loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Clemencio Raimundo

texts.pt:
Clemêncio Raimundo A. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique vive maritalmente é pai de um filho de apenas 2 anos. tem 35 anos de idade estudou ate a 10ª classe teve que parar devido ao trabalho que não lhe permitia mais frequentar a Escola, Responsabiliza se pela sua gêmea e seus sobrinhos comprando lhes uniforme e seu respectivo material escolar anualmente. 

Sai de casa dos seus pais quando a sua irmã mais velha é cedida uma casa e pede a ele para cuidar da mesma. No mesmo ano, sua irmã aranja um emprego  no Hotel Libombos pois esta é contabilista daquela reparticão, mas para isso ele tinha que ter no minimo a 10ª classe já concluida, e na altura só tinha a 8ª classe, Volta a estudar. Concluida a 10ª classe começa a trabalhar como recepcionista, cargo que exerce ate hoje. E funcionario permanente trabalha das 7h as 19h auferindo mensalmente um valor de 4.000.00MT, que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar por mês 500.00mt devido a sua obra que esta em acabamento.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Clemêncio na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos e outros). todos 4 foram no valor de 20.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade. Tem como objectivo ver a sua obra concluida e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobilar a mesma.pos esta ciente que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto pos conta com ajuda da sua esposa que e proprietária de um salão de beleza.
texts.en:
Clemêncio Raimundo A. was born in the Namaacha District, in the Maputo Province, South Mozambique. He is in a common law marriage and is the father of a 2 year old. He is 35 years old. He went to school until the 10th grade and had to drop out because his job no longer allowed him to go to school. He supports his twin sister and his nephews by buying their school uniform and supplies every year.

He left his parents home when his older sister was given a house and asked him to take care of it. That same year his sister found him a job a the Libombos Hotel since she was an accountant there. In order to get that job he needed to at least complete 10th grade and he only had completed 8th grade by then. He went back to school and after finishing 10th grade started working as a receptionist, a position he still holds. He is a permanent employee, works from 7am to 7pm and makes 4,000 meticais. He spends his salary in household expenses and saves 500 meticais due to his finishing construction. 

This loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticais, is Clemêncio's fourth with Hluvuku. He intends to buy construction material (cement, sand, bricks and others). All four loans were for 20,000 meticais and used for the same goal. His goal is to see his construction finished and to request a new loan to furnish his house. He believes he will repay the loan ahead of time since he can count on his wife's help. She owns a beauty salon.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, bricks and others)

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. She also buys and sells coconuts, fruits & vegetables. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional livestock and as working capital. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Roohi Bano's Group

texts.en:
Roohi Bano is from Lahore, the second-largest city of Pakistan, known for its history, gardens, and food. She lives there in the area named Mughalpura in a two-room brick house with her family. She is 41 years old, and the mother of four daughters and a son. All of her children are attending school and getting their education.

Roohi Bano is a very kind and supportive person in nature. She supports her family financially by operating an embroidery business at home. She has a good number of clients in her neighbouring area who give her regular orders every month.

Her husband also does embroidery, but the only difference is he makes embroidery designs with a sewing machine while she does the embroidery by hand. He operates a shop in the market where he offers embroidery services to his clients.

Roohi Bano has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his business. With the loan, he will buy another embroidery machine and hire a worker who will help him finish the orders on time. Her husband has been doing this business for over 10 years and Roohi Bano is hopeful that a loan investment will take his business to a more profitable level. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. Note: In the photo, the woman who is raising her hand is Roohi Bano.

loans.use: To buy another embroidery machine for their embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 30 years old, married and has two kids. The borrower graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to develop his tailor shop and purchase various kinds of cloth and a sewing machine. The borrower has a good reputation in the market and has lots of customers. The borrower sells his cloth at a reasonable price to his clients.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

She operates a restaurant business, cooking beans and rice, making tea and chapati (flat bread). Her potential customers are villagers and passersby. In addition she sells cashew nuts and paraffin to provider her with another source of income. Mwanaisha hopes to expand and establish a hotel in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kshs she wants to purchase stock of beans, rice, sugar, tea leaves, milk and cooking fat oil for her restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 and married with seven children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 7. Ofelia is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops to earn a living. She also raises hogs to augment her family income. Ofelia works hard to help sustain her children's education. 

Ofelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: sFor business expansion

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat lives in a big metropolis called Lahore, which is a city well known for its history and culture. She is 35 years old and has been living there with her family in the area named Mughalpura for over many years. She is a widow who lost her husband as a result of a sudden death. She has had a very difficult time since then. She has no children and does sewing work to keep herself busy and make a living. She also runs a scrap shop where she sells used items such as used paper, plastic bottles and iron to different factories and scrap dealers for profit.

Zeenat has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to improve her scrap business. With the loan, she will buy scrap in larger quantity to improve her sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to increase her household income by using the loan money. She is a new loan applicant for Asasah and this is her first loan application.

Note: In the photo, the woman who is raising her hand is Zeenat.

loans.use: To buy scraps for her recycling business.

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 49 years old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and three young children.  To supply additional income for her family, she is opening a local convenience store in her neighborhood.

Ma. Delia would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, canned goods and other supplies.  She believes in offering a relevant assortment and inventory of goods in her store for customers seeking convenient purchases. 

As a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Ma. Delia is grateful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long-term goals are to expand her retail business, fund the college education of their children, build a new house, a concrete and spacious one, and to support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her entrepreneurial endeavor.

loans.use: To purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, canned goods and other supplies

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Renita is married and has 3 children. Renita has a piggery business. She also helps her husband at their rice farm. She helps keep it free of weeds and pests and keep the rice crops healthy. Renita does her best to keep a balance between business and family. She makes sure to spend time taking care of her children. 

Renita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Renita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies, piglets and feed.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, piglets and feed

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
There is nothing so trashy that God cannot use it. Ma. Corazon L., 43, finished only high school, but that far contradicts what she has accomplished in her life. Ma. Corazon is married to Henry, a regular employee. They have two children; one is in high school and the other in elementary. Ma. Corazon's family resides in Caloocan City, Philippines.

Ma. Corazon presently owns a junk shop and runs a ready-to-wear (RTW) business. She has been in business for ten years now. People in her community serve as Corazon's target market, and every month she earns around Php 8,000. She accepts used bottles and old newspapers for recycling. She also sells clothes which suits the tastes of her neighbors and friends.

But life isn't all about business. Ma. Corazon sees in parallel the needs of her business as well as the needs of her children. Realizing that she needs more than what she can produce at the moment, she would like to apply for Php 38,000 loan. Ma. Corazon will use the money to buy merchandise in bulk for her business. She also intends to buy two computer units and start up a computer shop. 

She aspires for her junk shop to grow, because in the end, it will benefit her family, especially her children.  She faithfully attends weekly fellowship* meeting.

The price of junk items has gone down, and that really poses a business challenge to Ma. Corazon, but she knows that all things eventually work out for the good of God's people. God never treats His children like trash, and neither does Ma. Corazon. She values her children so much, and her desire is  for them to finish schooling and serve God in their lives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: additional bulk merchandise for inventory
